Rescale is a cloud-based platform for computational engineering and R&D. The startup is solving problems related to computational science and engineering. Relativity's Terran 1 is a 3D-printed rocket that has successfully passed significant milestones in the aerospace industry, including becoming the first nearly entirely 3D-printed rocket to fly and prove 3D printing is viable by passing Max-Q, main engine cut-off (MECO), and second stage separation. It is the largest 3D-printed object to exist, and it has nine 3D-printed Aeon engines on its first stage and one Aeon Vac on its second stage, all using liquid oxygen (LOX) and liquid natural gas (LNG) as propellants. Terran 1 uses 3D printing technology for its structure and engines and aims to transition to methane propellant on Mars in the future. The target performance capability of Terran 1 is to carry 1,250 kg to LEO with a height of 33.5 m and a diameter of 2.28 m.

Pipe is a trading platform that solves the problem of businesses lacking up-front capital to grow or invest. Pipe offers a range of capital products from flexible access to instant financing, to diversified portfolio investments. Pipe also works with a variety of businesses, including SaaS, D2C, and service businesses, to name a few, creating a modern liquidity platform that allows businesses to unlock their biggest assets.

Startup aims to solve the problem of revenue integrity and financial performance in healthcare organizations. La compania se compromete a generar ahorros desde el primer dia, sin necesidad de inversion inicial y sin interferir en las instalaciones de los clientes. Su objetivo es incrementar la competitividad de la industria, acelerar su transicion energetica y contribuir a impulsar la economia local. Con su experiencia en energia y conocimiento del sector industrial, desarrollan soluciones nuevas e innovadoras que responden a las necesidades energeticas especificas de cada actividad industrial. En resumen, NetOn Power resuelve el problema de la alta factura electrica de las empresas, proporcionando energia sostenible de forma eficiente y personalizada.

BlueFloat Energy is solving the problem of transitioning to renewable energy sources by investing in and developing floating offshore wind projects across the globe. They have the expertise and a successful track record in both bottom-fixed and floating wind project development and execution. They leverage this expertise in forming strategic alliances with local partners to create sustainable and bankable offshore wind projects that create the highest value for local communities. By unlocking new frontiers in the global energy transition, they seek to bring scaled decarbonization solutions to new markets. Their goal is to take a leading and proactive role in developing new markets for the global offshore wind industry and accelerate the transition to renewable energy sources.

ConnectGen is solving the problem of limited and aging power generation infrastructure in the United States by developing, building, and operating utility-scale renewable energy and energy storage projects that derive long-term, cost-effective, and clean energy solutions from the country's plentiful renewable resources, such as wind and solar. The company aims to create best-in-class projects that benefit multiple stakeholders, including landowners, communities, public officials, customers, and suppliers, by providing valuable energy and related services to utility and corporate customers, market-leading compensation for landowners, economic development and increased tax revenue for local communities, and preservation of the environment through industry best practices. They also create new local construction and operations jobs and support manufacturing jobs in the United States. ConnectGen's solar projects are currently generating 278 MW, and over 20,000 MW of wind, solar, and energy storage projects are in development across the United States.

Quantum Energy Partners is a sustainable energy investment firm that provides growth capital and credit-oriented solutions to private and public energy and sustainability companies. They invest in transformative energy and sustainability technologies and have a flexible investment mandate with a one team mindset. Their approach is high-tech and data-driven, and they are committed to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors, which they believe drives value creation. Their goal is to be a partner for progress in building energy companies that will help ensure a responsible transition to a net-zero carbon future, in order to meet today's biggest energy challenges with discipline and agility.

Carpe aims to solve the problem of excessive sweating for people who struggle with hyperhidrosis. The startup offers a range of antiperspirant and sweat-absorbing products for various parts of the body, such as the face, underarms, and breasts. Their products are designed to be effective and long-lasting, providing relief to customers who have tried other solutions with no success. In addition to their products, the startup also has a team of Sweat Advisors who are available to help customers manage their sweating. Their mission is to help people stop the sweat and improve their quality of life.

Cheetah is a wholesale food supply startup that promises clear and transparent pricing to its customers. Their next-day delivery service helps businesses manage inventory, and their 24/7 customer service is highly appreciated by customers. They offer a wide range of products and have a commitment to stocking items that are essential to the businesses they serve. Cheetah's focus on customer care and support has won the trust of many small businesses that rely on its products and services. Overall, the startup is solving the problem of accessibility and reliability of food supplies for small businesses in the San Francisco Bay Area.

EasyKnock is solving the problem of homeowners having limited options to access the equity of their homes. They offer two programs, Sell & Stay and MoveAbility, that allow homeowners to convert their home equity into cash which they can use to navigate life events, pay off debts, or make a more competitive offer on their next home. Sell & Stay program allows homeowners to sell their homes to EasyKnock and remain as renters for up to five years before they exercise the Sell & Stay Option to buy their homes again. MoveAbility program, on the other hand, allows homeowners to sell their homes and rent it back while they shop for their next homes. EasyKnock program allows homeowners to receive cash from their home equity without taking out a loan.

Honeycommb provides an all-in-one platform for creating independent social networks that users own and control. The platform offers a range of features such as group creation, community management, membership subscriptions, and home feed, among others. It is a turn-key solution that comes with everything required to engage and earn revenue from the community. Honeycommb's platform can be completely branded, from graphics to custom web & email domains, and publishes mobile apps to app stores on Apple & Google. The product also offers extensive customizations, integrations, and a built-in event system.

LISNR offers ultrasonic data-over-sound technology to enable proximity verification and contactless transactions for merchants, financial service providers, and mobility companies. The technology provides the flexibility to support favorable transaction fee and cost structures in payment experiences due to security and control, and faster and more seamless authentication experiences enabled with the combination of range and experience control. They offer range customization from a few centimeters to many meters with the best in class transmission reliability and confirmation, and clients have complete control of their data transmission experience based on their transport layer and business model. With their global patent portfolio, they have worked with Fortune 100 companies across millions of devices and use cases.

Super Coffee is solving the problem of finding a delicious, low-calorie, natural, and energy-boosting drink. They offer a range of flavors, including mocha latte and vanilla latte, with sustained energy, no sugar shock, and positive ingredients. In addition, their products are keto-friendly and contain 10g protein, 80 calories, and less than 1g of sugar. Super Coffee is also widely available, with over 70,000 locations. The company is inspired by positive energy and was founded by winning entrepreneurs who are committed to health and wellness. They have also been featured on Shark Tank and endorsed by celebrities like Jennifer Lopez and Alex Rodriguez.

The startup is a ticket-selling platform that provides buyers discounted and no-fee tickets for a variety of Broadway shows and musicals. They guarantee unbeatable ticket prices but don't explicitly mention solving any user problems.

This startup is solving the problem of students who need financial assistance to finance their education. They provide affordable loans to students from all backgrounds at qualifying trade schools. They offer flexible payment options that allow students to reduce or pause their payments in certain situations, such as income drop or unemployment. They also forgive any outstanding balance on the loan if the student hasn't finished paying it off within 15 years. Their goal is to make it easier for students to finance their education and kickstart their careers.

The startup offers a comprehensive esports betting platform for both hardcore gamers and those who enjoy watching online personalities compete. Players can also enjoy a complete suite of online casino games that they can play at home or on the go. Unikrn makes it easy for players to make multi-bets on the biggest esports tournaments and sports events simultaneously. Additionally, the platform provides fresh bets every 60 seconds for those who want to constantly have new and exciting matches to bet on. The startup aims to provide a world-class betting experience and make it easy for players to win big every day.

Map My Customers is solving the problem of inefficiencies in field sales management processes. The startup offers a mobile app with features like location intelligence, activity tracking, CRM integration, and account segmentation that help leaders lead their teams to sales success. It also helps sales representatives to prioritize their territory and filter by opportunity to find nearby prospects, import them as leads, and sync them back to their CRM while on-the-go. It improves the quality and accuracy of data related to field performance, enabling sales leaders to make better business decisions. It also saves time and increases productivity, thereby driving growth for the business.

DigiShares aims to solve the problem of tedious and costly issuance and management of physical securities for companies by providing a white-label software solution for the compliant issuance and management of digital assets and securities. Their platform enables the asset owners to digitize and issue their shares as tokens on the blockchain, which represent one share in the company, enabling lightning-fast settlement, 24x7 trading, access to international investors, and increased liquidity. They also provide technical assistance in designing tokens and smart contracts compliant with securities laws, managing allocation of shares, approval of investor verification, calling of votes, distribution of dividends, reissuing of lost tokens, and navigating the security token ecosystem. Their solution also includes the features of Investors' and Issuers' Dashboards, Share Cap Table, Payment of Dividends, Digital Stock Certificates, Automated Trading Compliance, Shareholder Meetings and Voting System, Freezing/Renewal of Lost Tokens, Investor Forum and Internal Trading, KYC/AML/accreditation, making the security token management simple and effective.

Radius aims to solve the problem of real estate agents and teams who lack the support and resources they need to grow and thrive in the industry. They offer a comprehensive range of services, including brand formation, marketing support, recruiting, training, financing programs, and more. Their goal is to empower performing agents and teams by providing them with the tools and resources they need to succeed. They also offer an equity ownership opportunity and wellness programs to promote a healthy work-life balance. The traditional brokerage model only offers limited support, basic insurance, and one-size-fits-all marketing support, which can hinder an agent's growth and success. Radius provides a more personalized and tailored approach to help agents and teams supercharge their real estate business.

Penny is a social sales enablement and learning platform designed to drive sustainable business growth by increasing sales and reducing churn. It uses AI-driven daily actions, performance scripts, and industry best practices to build repeatable behaviors that lead to new business growth, exceptional customer care, and repeat business. Penny also ensures that every seller receives the right training at the right time, by using micro-doses of content and a gamified experience with best-in-class social selling curriculum, skills application, and income-generating activity prompting. This way, it prevents churn by tracking progress, identifying churn risks, and optimizing learning pathways. Penny is useful for both corporations and distributors and offers contact management, learning and onboarding, operational efficiency, sales impact, adoption and services, security and integrations, and revenue impact calculator solutions.

NexHealth aims to simplify the healthcare experience by providing a patient experience platform that syncs with health record systems. By reading and writing appointments, forms, and more, developers can create healthcare apps without building costly integrations. With over 5,000 practices connected in less than a month and typical engineering cost savings of $875K, NexHealth provides online booking, messaging, payments, reminders, waitlists, marketing campaigns, analytics, and forms for providers. NexHealth's mission is to digitize the patient journey and make the healthcare experience more efficient.

Webflow is a website building platform that helps designers and teams create, collaborate on, and scale beautiful websites without coding. It is designed to help different professionals speak the same language, allowing design and engineering teams to work together more effectively. With Webflow, users can take control of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in a visual canvas, freeing up engineering teams to focus on more complex features. Additionally, updates to text and images on important pages can be made in minutes, making the process more efficient. The platform is used by more than 1.7 million designers and teams.

The startup aims to help website owners comply with the EU Cookie Law, which requires websites to give clear and detailed information about the use of cookies and provide ways for users to choose if they want to allow such use. The startup offers different services such as Cookie Banner, Cookie Notice, and Website Scanner to help website owners simplify compliance with ePrivacy and GDPR rules. By providing easy-to-use solutions, the startup helps website owners avoid breaking the law and facing potential legal action.

The startup provides consent and preference management software that enhances trusted personalization and demonstrates data privacy compliance. Their products include mobile app consent, OTT and CTV consent, and cookie consent that automate scanning and maintain records to ensure compliance. They also offer customization of consent banners according to the brand and regional needs, making it easy to deploy banners across domains with pre-built MarTech integrations. The startup's goal is to simplify cookie compliance and consent management and to help enterprises build trust with their customers by unifying privacy and marketing choices. They believe that regulatory and societal trends emphasize the importance of personal data consent and aim to provide reliable solutions for this challenge.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Evisort is a startup that solves the problem of inefficient contract management for enterprises and growing companies through AI-powered contract analytics and lifecycle management. Their contract intelligence offers automated workflows, searchable contract data, and real-time visibility into payment terms and cash flows. Evisort target customer groups such as in-house counsel, procurement, sales, finance, operations, and IT. The AI-based contract intelligence platform accelerates revenue recognition and compliance reporting. Based on Evisort's success stories, they have increased contract search and review times by over 93%, analyzed over one billion contract data points, and trained their AI tool on 11+ million contracts for market-leading accuracy.

Accelevents is an event management platform that provides multiple opportunities to bring people together and amplify excitement through gamification features. It offers a range of features such as registration, check-in, badge printing, custom fields, data enrichment, and in-depth analytics that work together seamlessly to provide a superior attendee experience. The platform is customizable, easy to use, and can be tailored to the unique needs of each event. Accelevents provides built-in live streaming, multiple event formats, and powerful engagement features for virtual and hybrid events, as well as integrated tools for flawless management of onsite events from registration to post-event surveys. It also offers multiple integration options with popular CRMs such as HubSpot, Salesforce, and Marketo to funnel data quickly and accurately where it needs to go. The key user problem that Accelevents is solving is providing an all-in-one platform for effortless planning, execution, and analysis of events of any size that require no design skills and offer a superior experience to participants, exhibitors, and organizers.

Truepill is a startup that operates in the healthcare industry, aiming to transform consumer healthcare through their telehealth and pharmacy platforms. They offer access to a nationwide, 1,000+ specialty clinician network delivering video/phone, asynchronous, and chat-based virtual care. The pharmacy platform offers full formulary accredited pharmacies that ship Rx and OTC products to 50 states, supporting insurance coverage and cash. Truepill's goal is to streamline every step of the healthcare journey using a suite of customizable solutions. They enable accessible care anywhere and work with accredited pharmacies, labs, and providers to facilitate healthcare across the country. In short, Truepill is solving the problem of limited access to healthcare by bridging the gap through telehealth and pharmacy services.

Snyk is a developer security platform that helps developers find and fix vulnerabilities in their code, open source dependencies, containers, and infrastructure as code. It provides industry-leading security intelligence to monitor and continuously scan for vulnerabilities while developers work. Snyk's actionable fix advice helps developers fix vulnerabilities easily with a click, seamlessly integrating with their existing IDEs, repos, and workflows. Snyk also offers resources for self-service security education and comprehensive vulnerability data. The platform is designed to integrate with favorite languages and tools, ensuring that developers can ship their products on time with peace of mind.

Fount aims to solve the problem of achieving optimal health and performance by creating personalized health and performance programs tailored to each individual's unique body, goals, and lifestyle. With their Collect - Experiment - Refine approach combining sophisticated AI, Experiment Journey method, and elite integrative coaches, they help people understand their body, synthesize data, and give customized strategies to support their unique goals. Their flagship program, FlyKitt, eliminates jet lag and rapidly shifts circadian rhythms by reducing inflammation. The program was developed from research with Navy SEALs and fighter pilots. They provide one-on-one coaching with targeted health and performance experiments for rapid progress and results.

The startup provides a cookie consent management platform (CMP) called Cookiebot that helps website owners make their use of cookies and online tracking compliant with GDPR, ePR, and CCPA regulations. Cookiebot CMP provides transparency and control over all the cookies and similar tracking on a website through three fully automatic core functions, including cookie consent, cookie monitoring, and cookie control. By using this platform, website owners can build trust with their users and avoid potential non-compliance fines. The startup aims to simplify and automate privacy compliance, taking into account the consent between end-users and the websites they visit. It helps businesses to avoid non-compliance fines and operate in compliance with data protection legislations.

Vowel is solving the problem of catching up on important meetings that one has missed. The startup provides AI-powered video meeting tools that help remote teams to host, summarize, search, and share video meetings without add-ons. The startup provides features such as AI-powered summaries, transcript, and recording alongside real-time AI action items that help reduce admin work and follow-ups. With Vowel, users can search for specific points discussed in the meetings and replay them for instant context. The startup has helped thousands of remote teams and individuals save time that would have been spent catching up on meetings.

This startup, Cookiebot, aims to solve the problem of website owners ensuring compliance with privacy regulations while still being able to use cookies and online tracking. The platform offers three automatic core functions: cookie consent, cookie monitoring, and cookie control to provide transparency and control over all the cookies and tracking on a website. This ensures full compliance with GDPR, ePR, and CCPA regulations. Cookiebot is useful for all websites with users from the EU, and it also supports over 40 different languages, enabling users worldwide to comply with privacy regulations. It is a popular solution, managing 13 billion user consents and used on over 500,000 websites.

Avochato is a startup that helps global organizations power text messaging communications. They offer a platform that enables businesses to send and receive text messages to different audiences more effectively and efficiently. The startup's platform allows businesses to handle multiple conversations at once and rely on powerful time-saving features to stay productive. It also has an autopilot meets human touch feature that sends automated texts based on different triggers and seamlessly transitions to 1-to-1 conversations when human interaction is needed. Their integration-first approach enables them to integrate their platform into existing systems like Salesforce, Slack and Microsoft Teams, allowing businesses to use the platform without disturbing their internal processes or creating extra work for their team. Lastly, their platform is built for enterprise and offers best-in-class security, compliance, and robust integrations to support large global teams.

Startup aims to solve the problem of bringing people closer together through play, regardless of their geographical location and without any additional app downloads. They create fast and efficient games that are accessible across all platforms and genres to connect millions of people. Playco focuses on instant play gaming technology to build innovative and disruptive games that billions of people can play together. Their goal is to change the future of gaming by making it more social and inclusive. They offer a range of games like Sway Stories, Heads Up! and Ask Away that enable players to have fun and interact with each other.

Cookiebot.com aims to solve the problem of minors in California who want to erase publicly available content. This startup aims to solve the problem of lead exposure in children and adults by offering high-quality and reliable LeadCare products that can identify and protect those at risk. The startup also offers teaching tools to graduate PNP students to increase awareness and prevent lead poisoning. Their mission is to prevent lead poisoning, which threatens millions of people, by identifying and protecting those at risk through their products and resources.

The startup provides high-speed internet services and aims to address the problem of data connectivity becoming a necessity in almost every task. The startup aims to solve the problem of low productivity and predictive accuracy for enterprise AI systems. They offer tailored solutions using adaptive AI models, simulation systems and context awareness to overcome the limitations of conventional AI/ML methods. Their goal is to help IT leaders build AI systems that can learn and adapt by adjusting their own parameters and behavior as variables change, and to understand relevant expertise in areas such as physics, human nature, biology and economics. The startup has partnered with several companies to develop precision AI tools and offers white label developer kits. They provide validated results of up to lower OPEX, faster processes and improved predictive accuracy.

It seems like AlphaTrAI is a startup offering artificial intelligence-driven solutions and tools for institutional, wealth, and retail clients. It aims to provide automated, accessible, and cost-efficient services to make investment easier and efficient. The team includes data scientists and experienced financial industry veterans, with board directors and advisory council members having years of experience in investment management, private investment, analytics, and risk management. CureMatch is a startup that offers oncologists and cancer care teams a service to assess NGS reports and other molecular profiling data for cancer patients. They provide a report for precision medicine to help doctors and patients identify the top matching therapy options. The startup uses advanced proprietary algorithms and curation of genomic, historical, and personal data for customized ranking and scoring of genomically matched combination treatments for cancer patients. CureMatch aims to provide oncologists with clear, accessible, predictive treatment analysis to equip them with actionable knowledge tailored for each unique case. Their goal is to contribute personalized combination therapy analysis to precision medicine, which provides actionable insights and ranked targeted drug treatments for oncologists, cancer centers, and their patients.

CureMetrix is a startup that uses Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology to develop powerful image analysis platforms that detect cancer and improve disease detection, reducing healthcare costs, and increasing efficiency. Their CureMetrix CAD software has the potential to reduce recall rates, increase early detection, improve evaluation of dense breast tissue and help physicians track treatment response over time. Additionally, the technology aims to improve clinical efficiency and scale up to address other cancers and beyond. CureMetrix's focus on Women's Health showcases a commitment to advancing technology that improves disease detection and cancer survival rates worldwide.

Analytics Ventures is solving the user problem of a lack of infrastructure for ideating, forming, launching, and funding new companies in the field of artificial intelligence (AI). They provide a complete support system for these startups, from the beginning to the end, helping them to grow in the market. This venture studio fund is located in San Diego, CA and focuses on supporting AI as its area of expertise. Their Twitter profile provides updates and insight into their work and may also act as a marketing tool to attract potential new clients.

TackleAI is solving the problem of tedious paperwork and repetitive tasks by implementing intelligent workflow automations through their innovative AI software. They use a combination of machine learning, computer vision and proprietary neural networks to turn unstructured documents into intelligible and immediately accessible data for organizations. They offer solutions in various industries such as Healthcare, Legal, Finance, and Defense by processing and analyzing thousands of documents in seconds while reducing human error. Their goal is to save organizations immense amounts of time and money by automating their current workflows and platforms, allowing their customers to focus on more important tasks. TackleAI's scalable and agile AI offers a quick implementation process and can work with virtually any client request.

Nextbite is a startup that offers a platform that connects everything needed to increase revenue through online ordering. The startup provides integrations and menu management tools to enable restaurants to streamline processing delivery orders from various platforms including Uber Eats, DoorDash, and Grubhub. Their service also includes consolidated reporting to help the restaurants monitor what is driving their delivery revenue so that they can optimize the business. Through its virtual restaurant brands, Nextbite helps restaurants to increase their existing kitchen revenue.

Angeles Investors is a startup funding community that invests in Hispanic and Latinx ventures. They identify, fund, and grow promising startups, particularly those with Hispanic and Latinx DNA. Angeles Investors recognizes top funders and venture capital firms investing in Hispanic and Latinx startups with the Angeles Estrellas award. They also honor Adelante Award recipients who have demonstrated exceptional dedication to the Hispanic and Latinx community. Their goal is to provide support to startups with diverse backgrounds, promote their growth and development, and recognize their achievements. Angeles Investors hosted its Q2 Pitch Night Event & Awards in Silicon Valley last May 12, where the Angeles 100 startups were recognized and promoted.

Ugami is solving the problem of providing rewards to gamers for using their debit card, as well as giving a gamified banking experience. The startup provides the option to earn up to 3x ugipoints on Ugami store, gaming, and streaming purchases and 1x ugipoints on everything else. Customers can earn more ugipoints by boosting their account and completing daily, weekly, and monthly streaks, leveling up, and spinning the wheel. Ugami also offers valued perks, such as peripheral insurance, credit monitoring, increased banking limits to customers who purchase the Boosted Debit Card. Overall, Ugami provides a unique banking experience by giving rewards to gamers who use their debit card.

SupplyHive is a startup that aims to provide procurement teams with a platform that analyzes, rates, and scores corporate suppliers at scale. It offers an AI-powered digital bees system that processes supplier reviews into a report that rates their performance both qualitatively and quantitatively, providing concrete action plans. The platform also allows users to see supplier ratings across the business and the world, negotiate contracts with real leverage, and help diverse suppliers improve and thrive within their organizations. By using SupplyHive, procurement teams can save time and money, build trust and relationships, and ensure they get the most value out of the dollars they spend with suppliers.

The startup Finix provides a no-code, white-label payments platform with embedded tools such as underwriting, dispute management, automated reporting and custom fee profiles, so companies can create a seamless and customizable payments experience that fits their unique business needs without spending days on integration. Their people-first approach aims to help companies optimize payments revenue and margins by offering flexibility in fee settings and payment acceptance methods, including ACH. Additionally, Finix offers a range of digital resources such as guides, webinars, and a payment glossary to help companies optimize their payments profitability, accelerate business growth, and improve customer engagement.

STOPWATCH™ is a startup that offers a cloud-based, unified commerce software that helps teams optimize profit across all online and offline retailers in real-time. The software effectively tracks where the startup's products are being sold, identifies the advertising tactics that work, maximizes human capital and minimizes chargeback. The real-time data signals produced by the software also inform the brand and product teams about WHAT, SO WHAT, and NOW WHAT,” which drives normalized analysis. According to some of the customers, the software has helped them take a proactive stance toward their online retail businesses, improve forecasting, and make smarter decisions. Overall, STOPWATCH™ aims to help businesses win in the blinding speed and complexity of e-commerce by delivering metrics and assisting companies to make moves based on data signals.

Storybook is an app that helps parents to create a strong and emotional bond with their children by including daily bedtime routine that includes infant massage reflexology and meditation, curated music to sleep and a routine of magical stories to share. It also provides several benefits such as better sleep routine, relieves pains such as growing pain, and colic, improves emotional health and mood, and stimulates the digestive system. The app has been recommended by several experts in the field, including PhD Christopher Lee from Harvard Medical School. It helps parents to create a consistent bedtime routine that facilitates a way to bond with their child through storytelling and massage and does not have children staring at a screen before bedtime.

The startup aims to provide recognition to the top 100 venture-backed startups with Hispanic or Latino leadership that have continued to attract investment, employees, and attention, by granting them the Angeles 100 Award at the Angeles Investors Q2 Pitch Night Event & Awards. The event also provides networking opportunities and sponsorships to facilitate the growth of these startups that meet the given criteria such as Year-Over-Year Growth, funding round from seed through series E, having Hispanic leadership or leadership team like Founder, Co-Founder, and/or Board Member, and incorporated in the United States. Startups can self-nominate or be nominated by their peers by submitting applications to be considered for selection. The Angeles 100 is not a ranked list, but rather a collection of amazing, accomplished, and inspiring venture-backed startups.

Fresh Bellies is a startup that is solving the problem of getting children to eat vegetables by offering a range of plant-based snacks that are seasoned with herbs and spices. They understand that parents struggle with finding ways to introduce vegetables to their children and have created a product that is nutritious, delicious, and convenient. The snacks are made without added sugars or excess salt, making them a healthier alternative to traditional snacks. Fresh Bellies offers a variety of flavors that are inspired by Latin American kitchens and are enjoyed by children and adults alike. Their mission is to make snacking an adventurous and healthy experience.

This startup is solving the problem of greenhouse gas emissions from aviation by creating a hydrogen-electric powertrain for aircraft. The aviation industry is the fastest growing contributor to greenhouse gas emissions, and regulators worldwide are pushing for net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. Hydrogen-electric powertrains offer a scalable, sustainable, and zero-emission solution for commercial aviation, which can reduce the life cycle emissions compared to turbines by up to 90%. This startup's innovative hydrogen-electric powertrain replaces traditional engines on existing fixed-wing aircraft, simplifying regulatory issues and reducing time to market. By using green hydrogen produced through electrolysis and electricity generated by renewable energy to power the fuel cell, the startup is also promoting the adoption of renewable energy and reducing the transportation costs that typically drive up the price of hydrogen.

Plug Power produces environmentally friendly 'green' hydrogen by incorporating a by-product hydrogen stream from a Chlor-Alkali process. Their comprehensive network of nationwide suppliers provides cost-effective solutions for industrial gases. They offer complete logistics solutions for the supply of gaseous and liquid hydrogen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide. The company provides competitively priced LH2 Dewar storage tanks and builds storage and evaporation systems for every application. Plug Power's goal is to accelerate the adoption of clean hydrogen on a global scale and build the green hydrogen economy.

EH Group provides fuel cell technology solutions that aim to generate clean energy. Their focus is on engineering and technology to develop sustainable power sources that support a more eco-friendly environment. By providing clean energy generation, EH Group is helping to solve the user problem of reducing carbon footprint and preserving natural resources for future generations. However, there is no specific information on how EH Group's fuel cell technology addresses user problems on an individual level.

Altergy Systems is a company that offers fuel cell solutions for backup power. They provide a solution to the problem of people having to constantly buy replacement batteries by offering a reliable and cost-effective alternative. They also offer sustainable, eco-friendly solutions to power outages, reducing the carbon footprint of businesses and organizations. Their products are used in various industries, including public safety, telecommunications, data centers, and healthcare. Altergy Systems also focuses on giving back to the community through their philanthropic efforts.

Infinium provides a solution to reduce carbon dioxide emissions by converting them into ultra-low carbon electrofuels. These electrofuels use renewable energy sources to create a hydrogen-based alternative to fossil fuels. The company aims to reduce harmful greenhouse gas emissions from planes, ships, and trucks significantly. Infinium's proprietary production processes are environmentally responsible, and their partners, such as Amazon, ENGIE, Denbury, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, have invested in the company to achieve their net-zero carbon goals. The startup's technology and partners' efforts show their passion for the future of fuel technology and its positive impact on the world.

It's Fresh Limited aims to solve the problem of food waste in the fresh produce industry by naturally extending the shelf-life and enhancing the eating experience of fruits and vegetables. Their ethylene control technology helps to slow down the ripening process, thereby reducing spoilage and waste. This technology can be used in transit, storage, and retail applications and is suitable for organic production. It allows for access to new markets by choosing more cost-effective logistical solutions, gain added flexibility in getting the crop to market at the optimum time, and extend suitable for sale time to maximize returns on produce. It also improves the consumer eating experience with longer at-home freshness.

The startup HyET Group aims to solve the problem of the world's rapidly depleting and expensive fossil fuel resources by providing cost-effective and energy-efficient renewable energy solutions. They offer affordable Solar PV, energy-efficient production of green hydrogen, low-cost and energy-efficient modular membrane reactors, roll-to-roll production of high energy density solid-state lithium-ion batteries, and technologies to accelerate the battery-hydrogen transition. Their goal is to accelerate the energy transition by making clean and abundant energy accessible to everyone.

Noble Gas Systems aims to solve the problem of safe and efficient storage of compressed gases, including hydrogen, for use in various applications such as transportation, energy storage and industrial processes. Their unique conformable high-pressure gas storage systems offer a solution to the challenge of storing compressed hydrogen fuel onboard vehicles without affecting passenger or cargo space. The company also has a focus on decarbonization efforts as evidenced by their recent installation of a hydrogen generator that produces green hydrogen using renewable energy. Additionally, they have received a competitive grant from the National Science Foundation to support ongoing development of their innovative technology.

Fairbrics startup is solving the problem of environmental pollution caused by the fashion industry. The startup is developing a sustainable and eco-friendly synthetic fiber that has a net positive impact on climate change. The majority of conventional materials used in the fashion industry are not environmentally friendly due to pollution and depletion of scarce resources. The fashion industry is known for generating almost 5% of all man-made CO2 emissions and contributing to the negative impact on climate change. Fairbrics aims to provide a sustainable solution to the industry's negative effects and meet the rapidly expanding market demand.

The startup Hazer Group Limited aims to provide innovative technology for the global industrial hydrogen market which potentially could produce hydrogen in a cost-effective way while also reducing the users' carbon footprint. Their low-emissions technology could facilitate more penetration into the sustainable energy market for both vehicle fuel and stationary power applications. Hazer is also seeking to provide high-quality synthetic graphite for energy storage and other graphite applications. Ultimately, their mission is to play an important role across three multi-billion dollar global markets by providing clean technology solutions for a safe and sustainable decarbonized future.

Startup aims to inform website visitors that they use both technical and profiling cookies on their website to help understand website usage. This website has a feature that allows users to access content using a screen-reader mode, making it accessible for those who have visual impairments or disabilities. The mode allows users to skip to different parts of the page, such as the content, menu, or footer, using keyboard commands. Users can also view job listings and apply for job vacancies by uploading their resumes and entering their email address. To apply, they must agree to the terms of service. Altair's HPC tools help solve the problem of managing complex distributed systems and compute clusters by providing seamless cloud bursting capabilities and advanced analytics support. Altair Mistral™ can monitor I/O, CPU, and memory, locate rogue jobs and storage bottlenecks and keep track of what's running on clusters. Altair® Unlimited™ offers a turnkey solution that includes software, system administration, and infrastructure as a service in a single, intuitive platform. Altair Breeze™ helps engineers quickly solve software deployment problems and file and network dependencies, identifying good and bad I/O for easy wins with detailed data for storage exports, and summary reports for sharing. Altair's platforms and solutions offer the performance, scalability, and flexibility to redefine what’s possible with HPC and are available both on-premises and in the cloud. Ultimately, Altair aims to simplify workload management, improve productivity, optimize utilization and efficiency, and simplify administration for clusters, clouds, and supercomputers.

Codiak Biosciences aims to create a new category of therapeutic medicines for patients, by engineering exosomes using their proprietary engEx™ Platform for manufacturing and engineering. This promises enhanced therapeutic targeting and potential for treating a wide range of unmet medical needs, with a focus on oncology and neurology. Their vision is to make precision exosome therapeutics a reality, for which they have built a robust pipeline leveraging their unparalleled understanding of exosome biology and scientific rigor. Codiak's goal is to use purpose-driven, innovative science to create revolutionary medicines for patients, striving to push boundaries in research and development.

This context is related to the website of AbbVie Inc., a pharmaceutical company that provides medicine to people around the world. Vizgen is solving the problem of limited understanding of biological systems that govern human health and disease by providing tools for in situ single cell spatial genomics. This platform allows researchers to identify nucleic acids in their native tissue environment with resolution scaling from subcellular to tissue scale, gaining new insight into biological systems. Vizgen offers various tools for researchers to probe neuronal signaling, cancer pathways, and investigate all major cell types. Their goal is to visualize gene expression in situ, making it easier to accelerate researchers' study of spatial transcriptomics.

Walkabouts is a startup that offers web-based lessons to activate pre-K to 2nd grade content with fun and standards-based movement, integrating kinesthetic techniques with classroom fundamentals. Walkabouts cover math, language arts and reading, and are correlated to the state standards teachers already use. The active lessons are research-based and evidence-based, providing reporting and assessments for teachers, schools and districts. Walkabouts are proven, powerful, versatile, and require no special equipment, training, or extra space needed. This startup aims to solve the problem of sedentary lifestyles among students, and to engage and activate each and every student to help them learn better through active kinesthetic learning.

WasteWizer Technologies provides real-time weight monitoring of waste containers for companies and haulers to improve their decision-making, reduce costs and environmental impact through their platform. By using either a deploy-at-will bar or a roller attached to the container, customers can easily monitor the weight of the waste through the company's app or dashboard. Their main goal is to increase profitability, safety, and sustainability for scrap, waste, and recycling firms and their clients, which helps them to send the right truck at the right time. WasteWizer builds internet-connected rugged scales that are designed to withstand harsh conditions and provide valuable insights to make businesses more productive and efficient.

AthletesGoLive aims to provide athletes, fans, and families with a superior streaming and scoring experience for their sports events. They offer live box scores, player stats, team stats, and live audio capabilities along with the built-in scoring system. AthletesGoLive also enables athletes to share in-game clips with college coaches, making it easier for them to get recruited. Their goal is to help the amateur sports community to conveniently watch and stream any game or match at any time on mobile devices, laptops, or smart TVs. AthletesGoLive is an all-in-one streaming and scoring app that serves as a one-stop solution for sports enthusiasts.

Sideqik is a startup that aims to simplify influencer marketing for e-commerce businesses. Its platform offers tools for discovering the right creators with the ideal audience, managing outreach, measuring engagements, and driving revenue in a streamlined and cost-effective way. They help businesses to build a revenue engine through creator partnerships and seamlessly quantify influencer ROI to increase revenue. Their new feature, called Workflows, is designed to manage the entire lifecycle of creator campaigns with maximum efficiency and ROI while keeping the process as simple or complex as their customers need. The startup has gained the trust of consumer brands around the world and offers case studies to showcase how they help top brands get more out of their influencer strategy.

Startup aims to solve the problem of simplifying 3D printing so that it can be accessed and utilized by everyone, not just experts. They provide tutorials, reviews, guides, and hands-on tests to support 3D printing enthusiasts. The startup also offers in-depth resources from 3D printing experts to help with any related challenges. The goal is to simplify the existing complex and technical aspects of 3D printing and enable more people to experiment with it by offering various basics, reviews, buyer's guides, and printables.

TEQ Charging aims to solve the problem of charging electric vehicles for the customers who do not have access to charging stations where they live and work. According to the statement provided, 85% of EV drivers primarily charge at home, but their buildings do not meet the growing need for charging stations. To solve this problem, TEQ Charging's platform optimizes existing infrastructure so new and existing chargers across any property can meet the demand. Furthermore, the startup helps Installation Partners and Site Owners by using any charger, retrofitting existing stations, and maximizing their investment by offering an 80% cost reduction per station. TEQ Charging's smart software provides process payments, control access, and view data and usage statistics, which integrates with OCPP compliant chargers and hardware.

PurpleCloud provides a software platform for performance management in the hospitality industry that connects management with their on-property associates to educate, motivate, recognize, celebrate and reward them. The platform optimizes service and performance management by automating tedious and inefficient processes to reduce stress and keep teams focused on the hotel’s priorities. It empowers team members to access real-time information, on-demand training, and translatable team chat, ensuring they have what they need to do their job in the most effective way possible. The platform is fully gamified to help inspire and motivate team members to achieve excellence, earn points for achieving goal contributing actions and leaderboards with encouragement features. PurpleCloud's goal is to establish and deliver upon a hotel's core goals and create a rewarding experience for everyone.

The startup seems to be Ecosystem Resources, which is an organization associated with Atlanta Technology Angels that provides educational resources to both investors and entrepreneurs. The organization covers various topics such as angel investment criteria, crowdfunding, deal leading, due diligence, valuation, financing terms, tax planning, and post-investment issues. They also have monthly educational events held at different venues and let the visitors know about them through their Events page on the website. Their machines use proprietary controls and a digital thread to unite process simulation, real-time sensing, and part inspection, ensuring the highest material quality and dimensional accuracy of engineered components. VulcanForms' laser powder bed fusion systems allow building metal parts at industrial scale, while their facilities provide limitless scalability without capital investment. They are ISO 9001: 2015, ISO 13485, and AS 9100D certified, as well as ITAR compliant, and their goal is to partner with the world's most innovative companies to realize breakthrough products.

This startup offers residential and off-grid solutions for those who want to take control of their energy. It creates a uniform structured new data taxonomy by using unstructured historical data as the input. This saves significant labor work. The AI also integrates multiple projects and plans for the entire value chain and predicts risks, cost, and opportunities based on real-time performance. This can solve the user problems of needing longer-lasting and cheaper batteries for wearable devices, electric vehicles, and renewable energy storage solutions. startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The startup aims to prevent chemotherapy-induced side effects for cancer patients, which impact the quality of life, are life-threatening, and can limit chemotherapy's effectiveness. They use a biomarker-driven approach to protect against the side effects of chemotherapy. The medicine designed for selective protection of healthy cells in patients with cancers that harbor p53 mutations can reduce or eliminate chemotherapy-induced side effects without interrupting chemotherapy's destruction of cancer cells. The goal is to shift the paradigm from acceptance and resignation to prevention. The startup wants to develop a targeted drug that prevents chemotherapy-induced side effects to help patients fight cancer more effectively with a better quality of life.

Akero Therapeutics is working to develop novel therapies to transform the lives of people living with serious metabolic diseases, particularly non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). Their flagship EFX program is designed to be a differentiated, potentially best-in-class treatment for NASH. They have multiple ongoing clinical trials to evaluate EFX as a treatment for NASH. Akero Therapeutics recently announced positive end-of-Phase 2 meeting with the FDA and SYNCHRONY Phase 3 program for Efruxifermin in NASH. They are actively looking for talented individuals who are driven to make a difference for patients.

Startup aims to solve the user problem of having an unpleasant browsing experience by informing them that the website uses cookies and showing them options to manage their preferences. They allow necessary cookies to facilitate the delivery of the site and inform users that other cookies are used in order to improve their experience. By providing users with the means to select their consent, the startup helps users make informed decisions about sharing their data while increasing transparency. The goal is to create a better browsing experience for users who are conscious about their privacy. The startup demonstrates its responsibility towards the users by providing them with the GDPR required information in a clear and easily accessible manner.

Braeburn's FluidCrystal® Injection Depot Technology aims to solve the problem of providing a slow release of medication for patients with opioid use disorder (OUD). By encapsulating the active ingredient in a liquid crystalline gel that slowly releases the medication over time, Braeburn aims to provide patients with longer-lasting relief from OUD symptoms, reducing the risk of relapse. The technology allows for a more controlled and sustained release of medication, reducing the frequency of medication administration and improving patient compliance. Braeburn is committed to transforming the treatment of OUD and believes that their innovative technology can help support patients in their recovery journey.

The startup is a healthcare technology company that aims to provide better health for more people through AI, connected care, and other innovative technologies. They are committed to advancing inclusion, diversity, and equity and protecting the planet. The startup values speed and decisiveness in achieving their goals. They have developed a MiniMed 780G system, which is a real-time insulin adjustment system for managing diabetes that has been FDA approved. They are also committed to innovation with purpose and aim to inspire bold solutions to the world's most complex and challenging healthcare conditions.

Intergalactic Therapeutics is aiming to transform medicine through non-viral gene therapy, offering a versatile non-viral cargo platform, customized therapeutic delivery approaches, rapid and efficient manufacturing processes, along with a diversified portfolio of treatments for eye diseases and beyond. This startup aims to solve the problem of using viral vectors for gene therapy, which can have serious side effects, by developing an alternative non-viral delivery system. By doing so, Intergalactic Therapeutics can provide safer and more efficient gene therapy treatments to patients. They recently presented updated data from their non-viral gene therapy platform at the 2023 Retinal Cell and Gene Therapy Innovation Summit. The startup is based in Cambridge, MA.

Initial Therapeutics is a startup that is focused on developing a new kind of drug that will stop the formation of difficult-to-drug protein targets, which play key roles in disease in its initial stages. They are using an original mode of disease intervention, which involves selectively stalling the formation of pathogenic proteins by designing molecules to enter the ribosome. Their approach aims to tackle known high-value targets and stop diseases before they start. They have received a $75 million investment from Apple Tree Partners to fund their research. The startup is developing transformative life sciences companies that will help prevent diseases.

Aethon Therapeutics is a startup that focuses on developing novel antibodies to selectively kill drug-resistant cancer cells in combination with targeted therapies. Its HapImmune™ platform is the result of the convergence of targeted and immune therapy. The company has been launched in collaboration with NYU Langone Health under ATP to eradicate drug-resistant cancer cells.

Aulos Bioscience is a biotech startup that aims to develop new IL-2 (interleukin-2) therapeutics for the treatment of solid tumor cancers. Their primary focus is to tip the balance toward immune activation, overcome past limitations in IL-2 therapy, and prevent the toxic side effects of IL-2, including vascular leak syndrome and pulmonary edema, to improve efficacy and safety. Their first investigational product candidate, AU-007, is designed to exquisitely direct the body’s immune system to kill tumor cells by unleashing the anti-cancer power of IL-2. Aulos Bioscience presented initial data from their first-in-human Phase 1/2 clinical trial of AU-007 at the 37th Society for Immunotherapy of Cancer (SITC) Annual Meeting, demonstrating a novel approach to long-standing obstacles in immunotherapy.

This startup, Deep Apple Therapeutics, aims to accelerate drug discovery through advanced computer-aided drug design technologies. They apply a state-of-the-art technology research platform based on advanced computational modeling, large-scale compound docking, cryo-EM-based structural biology, and deep learning. By accepting the use of cookies on their website, users' data will be aggregated with all other user data. Genius Enterprise provides a centralized and intuitive platform that allows corporate, government, and higher education institutions to manage and track compliance, certification delivery, and individual learning plans. The platform offers flexible registration, powerful reporting, full integration with more than 25 LMSs and 10 payment gateways, and end-user portals that enable easy tracking and self-service functionality. Administrators can compartmentalize data using hierarchy and access functionalities, and the platform supports eCommerce. The integration with numerous LMSs ensures data synchronization, and the user interface is designed to be intuitive and user-friendly. The startup solves the problem of efficient management of student enrollment, data sharing, and engagement of potential applicants in a cost-effective way.

Aspinity aims to solve the problem of high energy consumption and short battery life in always-on edge processing applications. Their patented analogML core enables an ultra-low power system-level solution that processes signals at the extreme edge, enabling insight-driven decision making as opposed to simple data-gathering. They offer solutions for voice activity detection, glass break detection, and condition monitoring, empowering battery-operated voice-enabled devices, home security and automation, and asset health monitoring. Aspinity's solutions save on costs related to data storage, transmission, and cloud computing, while providing additional features packed with ultra-low power analog signal processing. Overall, Aspinity helps achieve the lowest always-on AI system power, 20x longer battery life, and 100% elimination of irrelevant data processing.

The startup is Aterian, a consumer product platform that builds, acquires and partners with brands. Their products are built with the empowered consumer in mind and they turn data into products that people love by using proprietary technology that powers products from home appliances to essential oils. Their goal is to provide thoughtfully designed appliances large and small that improve consumers' lives. They rapidly reach economies of scale by automating the consumer product value chain, harnessing data to inform product development. Thus, the startup solves the user problem of finding value through ratings, reviews and rankings by providing approachable, fun and luxury-grade products that improve their quality of life.

TagStorm is an AR platform that allows users to easily create and publish AR experiences without any coding required, thus solving the problem of technical complexity and offering low friction for instant engagement. Users can publish their AR tour as a URL and share it on various platforms, including social media channels. Furthermore, tagStorm helps users analyze the performance of their AR content so they can optimize it for better engagement and conversion. The platform allows brands to gain deeper engagement with their end-users, reach wider and younger audiences, and associate more value with their products or brands. TagStorm specifically helps festival-goers and event attendees find real-time information about the event, navigate the venue, and find emergency or food and beverage services.

Celerium is providing Auto-ISAC with secure information-sharing solutions for collaboration among members. They aim to enhance cybersecurity in the automotive industry by making it easy for members to share sensitive communications, protect intellectual property and secure research and development initiatives. Auto-ISAC's strategic partner program includes innovators who support collaborating in managing the emerging complexity of automotive cybersecurity. Celerium is providing the Cyber Defense Network (CDN) for Supply Chains, with six guides available to the public to improve cybersecurity awareness, risk assessment, management, and incident response. ArmorText is also providing education and awareness training to Auto-ISAC members.

Aspinity is a semiconductor startup that offers an analogML core that enables near-zero power consumption devices for IoT and small consumer electronics by capturing the benefits of analog architectures for machine learning. Aspinity's solution eliminates the power penalty of moving irrelevant data through the digital processing system while still delivering highly discriminating analog event detection, thereby extending the battery life of consumer, IoT, industrial, and biometric applications. Aspinity's main goal is to help IoT device manufacturers to significantly reduce IoT infrastructure costs and accelerate all voice-assisted devices' deployment. The addition of Stephen DiFranco will help the team in identifying how the next generation of AI tech can create competitive advantages, impact outcomes, and streamline IoT services via hardware and software. Glen Clark will provide leadership in the delivery of Aspinity chips with an intuitive software development environment that allows customers to create their own algorithms for the company's novel analogML core.

The startup aims to solve the problem of businesses needing digital marketing services to increase their visibility and engagement, generate leads and achieve business growth. They serve organizations of all sizes in developing and executing digital marketing strategies, websites, apps, and eCommerce platforms to create business value. Additionally, they provide thought leadership to their clients through their blog, which includes tips on choosing hosting infrastructure to ensure digital marketing success.

W Capital Partners is a private equity firm that provides secondary liquidity solutions to shareholders of private companies and to PE/VC investment firms. They allow GPs to create solutions for maximizing future value potential and liquidity for LPs and co-investors while better aligning duration, equity reserves, fund terms, and GP economics for portfolio managers. They invest in companies where they can offer selected shareholders interim liquidity and then work with ongoing investors and management teams to execute long-term growth plans while offering access to their broad network of relationships and expansion capital to finance growth and acquisitions. They provide minority recapitalization, rollover equity, primary/secondary offerings, portfolio purchases, direct secondary share purchases, partial sell-downs, and tender offers. Their approach allows more time and value creation opportunities for growing private companies.

Jolt Energy Storage Technologies develops sustainable energy-storage technologies, including organic redox flow batteries and lithium-ion battery solutions. Their advanced molecular designs for VRES can improve safety by preventing battery overcharge, increase usable battery capacity, and reduce production costs by eliminating complexity in battery management systems. Jolt Energy was awarded a $250,000 grant from GCxN, a program that supports the development of technologies that address climate change, and has been nominated for Newsmaker of the Year by the Grand Rapids Business Journal. Their technologies aim to bring clean, reliable electricity to everyone by capturing and delivering energy from renewable sources.

Amplifi ID is a startup that aims to solve the problem of drug overdose harm by providing a drug checking solution for front-line healthcare workers. They offer a device that allows rapid identification of harmful substances in a drug mixture with a seamless test process. Their software also provides a real-time feed of drug checking results and analytics to track the trends of the unregulated drug landscape in communities. The company collaborates with healthcare experts to design their software to address the needs of a changing landscape and keep all stakeholders informed. Their technology has the potential to revolutionize the response and alerting to the community about drug supplies.

FREDsense Technologies has partnered with the Port of San Diego to develop a portable device that can provide real-time metals analysis for stormwater monitoring. The device will test the levels of various metals including aluminum, copper, lead, zinc, and nickel in San Diego Bay. The technology will enable the Port to easily and quickly access information related to stormwater which will benefit the Port and has the potential for adoption by ports and terminals worldwide. The project will result in real-time data in the field, enabling adjustments to Best Management Practices (BMPs) quicker than with laboratory data, which can take several weeks for results. The partnership is focused on environmental remediation and the protection of the bay’s water quality, a treasured resource for wildlife, residents, visitors, and local businesses.

Basepaws aims to help cat owners better understand their pets' breeds and health through comprehensive at-home DNA tests that analyze their genetic blueprint. These tests provide breed, trait, and genetic insights as well as an oral health report, with easy-to-read results delivered digitally. The company is approved by vets and scientists, and all lab results come from their own accredited laboratory in LA. With these tests, pet owners can identify potential health issues before they become visible or harmful, helping them avoid emergency vet visits. Basepaws also partners with animal rescue organizations, shelters, and TNR programs worldwide with a goal of improving the lives of cats.

The startup, Frog Creek Partners LLC, provides pollution control solutions for public works departments, cities, and other organizations with critically important watersheds. Their Gutter Bin and Mundus Bag products offer stormwater filtration, catching pollution before it reaches waterways and causing harm to fish and other aquatic life. The startup is solving the problem of water pollution caused by littering of cigarette butts and other forms of pollution. They provide scalable and customized filtration solutions with easily-serviced systems and measurable results for the largest adjustable overflow. Their solutions are backed by various state and ecological organizations that certify them.

ECOncrete offers a nature-based solution for marine construction that enhances biodiversity, promotes carbon sequestration, and improves water quality for both ecosystems and infrastructure. Their patented technology modifies the chemical composition of concrete and its surface to encourage biological recruitment, such as the creation of tide pools, while also offering structural benefits for coastal infrastructure. Their approach aligns with the blue economy workforce and demonstrates innovative eco-engineering solutions to protect and restore coastal ecosystems. Business partnerships, installations and scientific papers have validated their technology's ecological and structural performance, making it a promising solution for the challenges posed by traditional, homogenous rock armored shorelines.

Comfreight aims to make the trucking and logistics industry more accessible and fair. They offer transparent financing, payments, and software that eliminates payment delays. With HaulPay, they provide digital factoring and payments that reduce credit risk. Their load board helps find loads or trucks and automate invoicing and transactions. Additionally, they integrate with transportation software to automate invoices, payments, and more. Their goal is to save time, reduce risk, and increase efficiency in the trucking and logistics industry.

FREDsense Technologies Corp. offers a technology platform that enables the quick and effective integration of new sensors. Their sensors enable customers to analyze water quality faster, cheaper, and more efficiently, allowing them to make faster decisions in the field. FREDsense has developed sensors for monitoring trace contaminants including arsenic, PFAS, and COVID pathogens in wastewater. Their custom-designed FRED sensor is field-ready, allowing customers to sample and analyze water quality on site. Through their technology, FREDsense works with passionate water professionals to change the way people interact with water resources, ensuring they remain plentiful and clean for future generations.

CellectGen aims to solve the problem of early detection and prevention of dental implant failure and gum disease for the 64.7 million individuals who suffer from various forms of the disease. They have developed a saliva-based point-of-care platform technology to help dentists identify patients with a high risk of emerging active disease lesions in less than 15 minutes. The platform consists of a proprietary saliva collection and filtration device, a lateral flow-based test, and a mobile application that quantifies the results and guides treatment in real-time. This technology provides accurate, trackable, and cost-efficient quantitative results that identify individuals and sites at risk for future disease. The solution aims to make early detection of dental problems easier and more accessible for everyone.

Volta Power Systems provides a sustainable and reliable mobile power solution for any type of application. Their battery system can power RVs, off-grid adventures, and fleets without compromising the planet's future. The system gives access to instant power at the touch of a button, has silent operations for day or night, and eliminates CO2 emissions. It also provides complete engineering and design services, US-based manufacturing, and post-sales support for OEMs. Moreover, their system has the best CO2 reduction per cost ratio, with an ROI in 1 year or less at a lower cost than full-EVs.

This startup solves the problem of creating cleaner and more efficient gasoline-powered vehicles by utilizing their Ground-Breaking Ignition Technology. They have reported significant breakthroughs in their technology and have received recognition through the Automotive News 2020 PACEpilot Award. Their technology has many applications in emissions treatment and plasma processing, where they aim to maximize positive environmental and economic impact. Their N3P technology is the pulse that powers all their solutions, and they offer various applications to different industries.

Effenco is a startup that designs, manufactures, and markets technologies for the electrification and connectivity of heavy-duty vocational trucks. They provide full electric and hybrid electric solutions to fight climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Their technology is modular and scalable, which can be installed either on new heavy-duty vocational trucks or on existing fleets, making it adaptable to the customer's needs. Effenco has been nominated for the 2021 Global Cleantech 100 list of companies committed to delivering the future, which recognizes companies around the world that provide solutions to meet climate change challenges through clean technologies. Their goal is to provide electric and affordable solutions to their customers for a greener environment.

Astrocyte Pharmaceuticals is developing neuroprotection therapies for various brain injuries such as Traumatic Brain Injuries (TBI), concussions, stroke, and neurodegenerative disorders. Brain injuries are a common medical condition, and the brain has a limited capacity to repair itself, making it vulnerable to injury. The company focuses on the potential role of astrocytes and other glia cells in the maintenance and repair of the brain after injury. They are investigating several programs for stroke, TBI, concussion, and other brain injuries with AST-004 as their promising therapeutic. The developments in the clinical program have been presented in various announcements. Astrocyte Pharmaceuticals' goal is to develop innovative therapies to treat and prevent brain injuries and associated disorders.
