startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: 3Derm, which is now a part of Digital Diagnostics, offers ImageAssist to help patients take the right photos for medical purposes. The startup aims to solve the problem of inaccurate or blurry images that can lead to incorrect diagnoses. They provide a solution using advanced imaging technology and telemedicine to offer accurate and efficient diagnostics. Their goal is to improve healthcare outcomes and access by leveraging technology to connect patients with healthcare providers and specialists. 3Derm now operates under the Digital Diagnostics brand and offers a range of diagnostic solutions using AI-powered tools and proprietary technology.

The startup provides urgent care software designed specifically for the urgent care industry that streamlines operations, improves patient experience, and optimizes revenue for the clinic. It focuses on reducing documentation time and increasing the time spent on patient care, anticipating patient needs and keeping up with changing business realities, and providing an intuitive system for efficient charting. The software registers patients in less than 2 minutes, charts 80% of the most common visits in under 60 seconds, reduces days in AR, and collects 2x more payments. The goal is to provide an excellent experience that drives repeat visits. In addition, the startup offers remote board-certified radiologists for over read services and expertise from industry experts to help open, expand, or enhance urgent care businesses.

Cellbricks aims to solve the problem of the shortage of human tissue and organs for transplantation by developing a technology that allows for replicating human tissue and organs at scale. The startup combines synthetic biology and 3D bioprinting to create tailor-made bioinks that can replicate complex human tissue with multiple cell types and materials, a human-like extracellular matrix, and high resolution. Their mission is to provide researchers and doctors with better clinical treatments and help patients enjoy longer and healthier lives. By leveraging their expertise in tissue engineering and proprietary hardware, software, and process engineering, they have already created functional mini-organs like cartilage, liver, vascular structures, bone, placenta, and a disease model for drug development. The interdisciplinary team of 20 biotech enthusiasts, scientists, PhDs, engineers, chemists, and entrepreneurs from all over the world work together closely with KOLs in science, medicine, and pharma to achieve Cellbricks' ambitious goals.

Cake is a startup that offers a platform to help people plan for end-of-life events. They provide educational content on end-of-life topics like creating a will, planning for aging parents, making health decisions, and exploring mortality. Cake also offers an online tool called the Will Maker, which provides a do-it-yourself option for creating a will at an affordable rate. The startup does not provide customized advice or legal services, users are encouraged to consult with an attorney if they need help with specific legal needs. Cake aims to make planning for end-of-life easier, less intimidating, and more accessible to everyone.

ProCredEx is a startup that aims to make credentialing and compliance processes easier and more efficient with their collaborative networks and compliance tools. By connecting everything in a compliance ecosystem and using blockchain technology to ensure reliability and traceability of data, ProCredEx streamlines the auditing and reporting process. The startup seeks to solve the problem of outdated, time-consuming credentialing methods by providing a secure tool for credentialing professionals to acquire verifications and resell data they have verified themselves to other organizations. ProCredEx's goal is to reduce costs, improve access to care and improve overall quality of service.

Startup solves the problem of storage for on-premises video surveillance management systems that require extended capacity by offering a hybrid cloud storage solution. With Wasabi’s cloud storage strategy, businesses have a reliable data storage solution that protects against ransomware and provides robust data protection with immutability and offsite backups, at 80% less than Amazon S3 and no hidden fees. The enterprise cloud helps organizations with their cloud storage migration and provides a solution that fits their needs. This startup manages to make cloud storage effortless and offers a simple solution with no extra fees.

Deep 6 aims to solve the problem of slow and bottlenecked clinical trials by using AI-powered precision-matching software that mines millions of patient records, including unstructured data such as physician notes, pathology reports, and lab results, to pinpoint eligible study patients in real time. With dynamic, holistic patient views generated by concept mapping and 120+ ontologies, researchers can quickly identify which patients could qualify but are missing key lab results and continue to monitor enrollment in real-time, allowing for KPI-driven recruitment and enrollment. Additionally, Deep 6's solutions offer real-time patient counts by site and by recruitment stage and show physicians which studies their patients qualify for, enabling easy referrals. Ultimately, their goal is to enable healthcare organizations and sponsors to accelerate their clinical trials, understand where their patients are located before starting a trial, and match patients to the right studies in minutes rather than months.

Reflect aims to solve the problem of finding the right therapist for individuals seeking mental health support, regardless of their location or insurance. The startup has built the largest and most diverse network of therapists in the West Coast, who provide longer therapy sessions and use feedback and best practices to ensure a high-quality therapy experience. Reflect also offers a personalized matching service with its expert care concierge to ensure that individuals get the best match, leveraging data-driven matching based on 55 data points. Additionally, Reflect provides the convenience of working with both in-person and teletherapy sessions and helps individuals save more on therapy by using their existing PPO benefits. Overall, Reflect's goal is to simplify and support the process of finding a therapist for individuals seeking mental health support.

The startup offers logo development services to its clients, ensuring that they get a smart and unique logo that represents their firm. The company has been developing innovative and restorative medical products since 2014 and has launched several successful products in the market.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: SeaStar Medical's patented technology provides life-saving solutions to critically ill patients by preventing cytokine storm, which can result in multiorgan damage and death. The company is developing and commercializing cell-directed extracorporeal therapies that target the effector cells that drive systemic inflammation. SeaStar Medical's innovative Selective Cytopheretic Device (SCD) provides a simple-to-use solution to fight hyperinflammation and restore reparative functionality to the body and potentially reverse injury. Thanks to SeaStar Medical's rigorous clinical research and robust scientific evidence, a shorter treatment regimen may reduce dependency on dialysis and time in ICU.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Ocuphire Pharma is a clinical-stage ophthalmic biopharmaceutical company that focuses on developing and commercializing therapies for the treatment of refractive and retinal eye disorders. The startup is solving the user problem of visual impairment by developing two different products, Nyxol® eye drops and APX3330 tablets, that target pharmacologically-induced mydriasis, presbyopia, dim light or night vision disturbances, diabetic retinopathy and diabetic macular edema. Nyxol® is a once-daily preservative-free eye drop formulation that is designed to reduce pupil size and improve visual acuity. APX3330 is a twice-a-day oral tablet, designed to inhibit angiogenesis and inflammatory pathways in retinal and choroidal vascular diseases. The kiosks only require a 110-AC Volt plug and can be paired with an internet-capable SIM card for wireless access. The startup provides customizable kiosks to fit any kit size necessary for medical testing.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The startup aims to solve the problem of improving heart failure care for patients by providing accurate, personalized, and efficient care. They offer a non-invasive and scalable intracardiac pressure monitoring system called the Acorai Heart Monitor that continuously monitors intracardiac pressures to improve medication decisions, patient stability, reduce length of stay, and ensure stable discharge to reduce readmission rates. Their device uses a first-of-its-kind hardware architecture and machine learning to generate absolute intracardiac insights for decision-making across all stages of heart failure. They may share user information with social media, advertising, and analytics partners.

Entrepreneurs can use the platform to raise capital and build a portfolio of emerging private companies, and investors have access to new investment opportunities and can invest in ideas they believe in. They also provide defense applications for strategic and tactical SAMs, insensitive munitions, and rapid satellite replenishment. startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Webflow is a website builder that offers a variety of features for creating and hosting websites. They offer fast and scalable hosting with advanced security and dedicated partnership for enterprise-scale growth. Their free Starter plan allows users to try Webflow for as long as they like with the ability to integrate custom code or leverage their CMS API. Webflow is ideal for designers, marketers, and developers who want to create, publish, and optimize websites without coding.

Bond Pet Foods aims to solve the problem of negative environmental impacts caused by the daily consumption of animal protein by dogs and cats. They use precision fermentation to harvest nature-identical and completely sustainable chicken, turkey, beef, and other high-value proteins that can serve as the foundation of pet food recipes, without harming other animals. Their world-class team uses similar processes to those used in craft brewing to produce highly digestible and bioavailable meat proteins that are nutritionally complete and scalable. They are on a mission to craft a better meat, and they offer wholly sustainable formulary options for pet food manufacturers who want to diversify their protein options.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Boost Biomes aims to harness the potential of microbiomes and use them to provide novel, sustainable solutions in order to feed and heal people around the world. The startup uses its proprietary discovery platform to identify microbial products and understand microbial interactions. They are presently focused on reducing crop loss due to fungal pests in the field and post-harvest by using microbiomes. Their platform is faster and less expensive than traditional approaches and identifies multi-microbial products, which are often more effective than single microbe products. Their goal is to increase overall yield in the field and extend the shelf-life of fruit and vegetables after harvest. They work with partners to discover, develop, and distribute products to farmers and offer an organic and safe biopesticide for crops that don't have regulatory burden for growers and safety concerns for consumers.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Stockguard is a startup that provides risk management solutions for livestock producers through its Livestock Risk Protection (LRP) and Livestock Gross Margin (LGM) programs. LRP protects cattle and swine producers from unexpected market price drops, while LGM uses adjusted futures prices to determine expected and actual gross margins. These programs offer simplicity, affordability, and transparency by combining USDA livestock insurance, CME hedging, and proprietary insurance programs. Stockguard was built by producers for producers, and offers tailored plans and short applications to help customers start protecting their operations sooner. The startup's goal is to ensure that livestock producers can stay profitable in the long term despite the challenges of the industry.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Koidra is a startup that offers intelligent automation solutions to greenhouse and industrial processing facilities. Their products allow users to monitor and analyze operational data in real-time, receive smart alerts that anticipate and prevent issues, and automate control decisions for increased efficiency and cost savings. The startup has partnered with leading US universities and landed a $3.77M USDA grant. Koidra's products are built on years of world-leading machine learning research and industrial controls expertise and can optimize operations and improve the bottom line. The startup has raised $4.5M seed funding to bring intelligent automation to greenhouses and beyond.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Lithos Carbon offers a solution for farmers to sequester carbon and increase crop yield by providing a basalt application plan which regulates soil pH to the crop's optimum requirement, replenishing the nutrients in topsoil, and increasing plant resiliency to droughts and pests. Their machine learning algorithms optimize a unique application strategy for carbon capture, crop yields, and soil health by partnering with farmers. Lithos Carbon helps organize feedstock delivery, soil sampling, and application, covering the associated costs. Therefore, Lithos Carbon solves the problem of reducing farmers' carbon footprints and earning revenue from carbon removal while optimizing their crop yields and soil health.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Bountiful provides data-driven analytics and forecasting solutions for farmers and food and agriculture industry professionals. Through their tools, they offer accurate yield forecasting for specialty crops, access to daily market insights and weather forecasts that evolve throughout the growing season. Their technology helps to bridge the gap between data and sentiment, providing actionable insights necessary for informed decision-making and helping farmers to achieve significant savings on water and labor costs. Bountiful specializes in almonds and grapes in California and Australia but also provides country, state and county forecasts and analytics services globally. Their goal is to provide a trusted, empowering and seamless tool for smarter agriculture and to change the future of farming for a multitude of high-value specialty crops.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Fieldin is a digital platform that aims to help high-value crop growers monitor and optimize their operations using smart sensors, mobile applications, and a cloud-based platform. It provides various features such as real-time monitoring of equipment for critical operational efficiencies, inventory management for all equipment, and maintenance tracking for better planning. Fieldin also offers insights for maximizing capital equipment utilization, optimizing shifts and engine hours and real-time visibility for better-informed decisions. With Fieldin's digitization of grower's operations, customers can track every aspect of their operation, regardless of how large and distributed it might be, by reducing variability across equipment, operators, and regions. Lastly, its benefits are a reduction in operating finances, improving the coverage area per shift, and extra acres covered per day with each sprayer.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Verdant Robotics is solving the problem of labor shortage in agriculture by providing autonomous robots capable of growing specialty crops at superhuman scale. Their technology uses data analytics and crop applications to improve profits, environmental stewardship, and unlock new value for farmers. They provide robotics as a service while keeping farmers in control of their operations. Verdant’s technology is designed to eliminate overspray, protect crops, and ensure lasers and chemicals are hyper-precise and always under human control. They are located in Silicon Valley and Central Valley and can be contacted through their website.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: This startup provides a sustainable solution for animal feed and crop fertilizer by using insect-rearing technology that converts mealworms and their byproducts into nutrients. Their sustainable products include whole mealworms, protein meal, and mealworm oil that can be used in animal diets for pets, fish, poultry, and swine. They also produce frass, a dry fertilizer and soil amendment that positively impacts soil health and stimulates plant growth and immunity. The startup's goal is to address the global demand for animal feed and crop fertilizer and to promote a sustainable food system that mirrors nature.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: AgCode is a farm management software startup that provides solutions for growers to maximize their efficiency, gain valuable insights, and improve profitability. AgCode tailors their solutions to each crop, giving growers a clear overhead view of operations. Their goal is to get farmers out of the office and into the field by providing technology that works. The startup has been providing comprehensive farm management software since 2003 and have a large base of enterprise growers and family farmers as their customers.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Performance Beef and Performance Ranch are startups that help livestock producers manage their operations more efficiently. Performance Ranch helps cow-calf producers with real-time management decisions, inventory tracking and health data collection. Cirba Solutions is a startup that provides battery recycling services, focusing on processing end-of-life hybrid and electric batteries, gigafactory scrap, and end-of-life consumer batteries. They offer flexible and adaptable solutions for electronic vehicle battery recycling, including complete battery deinstallations. They divert end-of-life batteries away from landfills and safely recycle each component. The startup is uniquely positioned with a platform of services and products to address lithium-ion and cross-chemistry batteries at end-of-life. Their mission is to enhance the cross-chemistry supply chain and deliver sustainable and battery recycling solutions.

The startup provides custom x-ray and CT scan solutions for various industries such as military, aerospace, and medical to help them with their quality assurance and non-destructive testing needs. They save clients time and money by offering personalized systems with desired features. They aim to improve production for their clients by providing programs, techniques, and procedures beyond the x-ray machine. They train the client's team to use the system efficiently and provide post-sales support, upgrades, and on-site assistance. The startup is trusted by various industries and has over 25 years of experience in this field.

P1 Dental Partners is a Dental Partnership Organization that prioritizes patient outcomes through clinical autonomy and access to the latest technology and treatments. Their goal is to provide a higher level of compassionate care for their patients. They seek to remove business barriers between doctors, staff, and patients, and give the practice the ability to continue to grow the goodwill they have built with patients and the community for decades to come. They work together to vet new technologies and strategies that enhance the quality of patient care and practice operations. They offer operational support (HR, IT, Recruitment) that gives their dentists the peace of mind and focus to continue to deliver elite patient care. Their aim is to protect the integrity of dentistry from the world of corporate dentistry that too often prioritizes quotas over quality care.

The startup offers a variety of power tool accessories and hand tools suitable for contractors, professionals working in the trades, commercial automotive shops and do-it-yourselfers since 1940. The company's products include tape measures, hole saw sets, knives, nut drivers, and pliers. Century Drill and Tool also provides a selection guide to help customers identify the right tool for their project. The startup promises to provide easy to read and quick measurements using its products, along with spring-loaded designs for ease of use. It aims to solve the problems of finding the right tool for a project and reading measurements quickly.

Swipesum is a payment processing and merchant services consultant that helps businesses save money on their payments processing by providing the best credit card processing solutions for their unique business needs. They provide a free initial consultation to help businesses determine which payment processing solution is right for them, and they analyze over $7B in processing volume. With a team of payment consultants and statement reading software, Swipesum can quickly and efficiently identify unnecessary fees and rates. Their goal is to eliminate most fees associated with accepting payments and to save businesses money on payments processing.
venture_capital_fund_investment_industri: Telecommunications & Media, Business Services, Real Estate

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Atlas Digital Group is solving the user problem of slow sales growth and inefficient sales channels for broadband operators. They provide a next-generation digital commerce solution, called Atlas CORE, which is designed to accelerate sales growth by providing customer-centric sales experiences that are optimized with decades of industry best practices. Atlas CORE also offers powerful analytics to help leverage robust full-funnel data capture, reporting and analytics to drive insights into digital sales performance and consumer behavior. They aim to streamline sales operations with an order management platform capturing not only orders but also leads for additional sales opportunities. Atlas Digital Group is becoming a critical tool for success with broadband operators.
venture_capital_fund_investment_industri: Telecommunications & Media, Business Services, Real Estate

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: BizzyCar is solving the problem of hassle-free recall scheduling process for vehicle owners. Their AI-based platform automates recall management by identifying the vehicles with open recalls and proactively reaching out to the owners to initiate the recall service scheduling. With their services, they aim to increase safety compliance and decrease vehicle downtime, ensuring safer vehicles on the road. They are also striving to reduce the legal and financial liability of OEMs by helping them resolve recalls. BizzyCar's services are trusted by OEMs, independent dealers, franchise dealers, and fleet operators.
venture_capital_fund_investment_industri: Telecommunications & Media, Business Services, Real Estate

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup Gelatex aims to solve the problem of creating better materials using nanofibers, which has potential applications in cultured meat, tissue engineering, wound care, and filtration. They use a new technology called #halospinning to unlock the potential of nanofibers. As a materials technology startup, they are providing innovative solutions for various industries to create better products that can improve people's lives. There is no further information about how their technology specifically addresses user problems.

FanSifter is solving the problem of helping music, entertainment, and sports events to sell more tickets through its machine learning-powered fan data analytics platform that provides powerful segmentation, profiling, and enrichment tools. It utilizes AI across the platform to enable end-to-end tracking down to granular fan profiles' performance. FanSifter's solution fills a gap in the market and benefits many verticals in events. The platform offers personalized experiences to fans by launching smarter campaigns through email, text, Facebook, or Instagram. FanSifter's participation in the Techstars Music Los Angeles mentorship-driven accelerator program provides personal time and advice from senior VPs and CxOs and founders of top-tier US VC investors, benefiting the platform's growth and development.

Planet42 is a car subscription company that provides entry-level brand new cars to customers in South Africa who are unfairly ignored by banks. The company has raised $50m in equity and debt and has listed more than 7,000 cars to customers in South Africa. Planet42 has plans to expand into Mexico and hopes to have purchased over 1 million cars for its present and future markets by 2025. The car subscription company financed the farm for months with money from carbon offset credits. By expanding their services, Planet42 aims to solve the problem of transport inequality and lack of access to car ownership for millions of people in developing countries.

Planet42 aims to solve the problem of car ownership for South Africans who are unable to secure car finance from banks. They offer a rent-to-buy car subscription service that allows customers to choose a used car from any of their partnered dealerships. Once the application is approved, Planet42 buys the car and rents it to the customer on a subscription basis, which includes insurance and a tracker device. They also offer a buy-out option, where the customer can purchase the car outright at any time for the buy-out price that decreases every month. Their goal is to democratize mobility and make car ownership available to everyone in South Africa who can afford it.

Gelatex aims to solve the problem of high costs associated with producing cultured meat by up to 90%. They do this by producing nanofibrous scaffolds which enable cells to grow akin to their natural environment. Their semi-industrial machine can produce the scaffolds, which are priced at under €1k per kilogram, needed to grow one steak within minutes for a fraction of the cost of competitors' machinery. The company is also currently developing a machine that produces the scaffolds three times faster and could make cultured meat commercially viable in the next year or two.

KWOTA is solving the problem of reducing CO? emissions by increasing the adoption of a circular economy. Materials that have been recycled are being used to create carbon credits, leading to a reduction in emissions. KWOTA uses a science-based approach and verified activity data to calculate carbon credits and provide a transparent and traceable process. By getting involved with KWOTA, suppliers can increase the reuse of secondary materials and get paid for creating carbon credits, while buyers can compensate for their company's carbon footprint by supporting the circular economy. The goal is to address the urgent need to reduce CO? emissions by 20 billion tonnes annually and avoid a global climate crisis.

Nordigen provides a free banking API service for account information service providers (AISPs) with a lightweight, low-cost infrastructure. They have a massive list of signups to be processed due to the current and upcoming regulations under PSD2 and PSD3, which gather more data. Nordigen also aims to help bank loan applicants by switching to bank data from credit histories to include more people into the effective system of credit. Nordigen has only raised €1.4m as they are trying to actually generate revenue and the goal is to finance the banking API for free through analytical solutions on top. Nordigen believes that their freemium open banking API, instead of being the cheapest solution on the market, is the best thing that can happen for the consumers.

Startup INZMO aims to solve the user problem of paying a hefty deposit upfront when renting a property. They are planning to launch Germany's first fully digital rental deposit guarantee service that will target the rental market. Through the INZMO app, users can buy or change policies and submit claims for rental deposit guarantee service. The startup has raised €5.2 million to date and plans to double its team with the fresh funding. Swiss insurance company Helvetia has participated in the seed round and supported the startup from the pre-seed round in 2018.

startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The startup described in the context is Eurora Solutions.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup aims to solve the problem of cross-border compliance services for companies who want to expand their business to new markets. It provides fully automated AI solutions that manage all aspects of cross-border trade, such as HS Code Allocation, Duty & Tax Calculations, Restrictions Screening, Customs Declarations, IOSS Registration, and VAT Agent services. Their services can save time, resources, and increase customer satisfaction while handling large amounts of data instantly and precisely. They offer flexible solutions for online sellers, logistics/postal, and marketplaces to boost accuracy, increase efficiency, and manage the global acceleration of eCommerce. Their goal is to simplify global trade for companies and automate every aspect of the supply chain to move goods and parcels faster and with lower resource cost.

Werk is a recruitment and relocation platform that aims to connect trusted employers with the best tradespeople in the manufacturing, construction, and solar industries. It provides innovative skill testing tools and trade-specific tests to evaluate the expertise and capabilities of potential candidates, ensuring that employers hire only the most qualified professionals for their projects. Werk offers a relocation service to ensure a smooth transition for both the employee and the employer. The goal is to give workers a chance to find better jobs with better pay at employers who value and respect them. Werk also provides a Job Order Self Service platform designed to simplify the recruitment process, enabling employers to specify their requirements and easily submit their job orders online. With Werks' extensive network and partner connections, it provides access to a talent pool of over a million specialists.

The startup aims to solve the problem of student engagement in math, both in the classroom and during distance learning. It provides a platform that generates tasks for students based on their selected skill, allowing them to play classroom live games or assign homework. The games are designed to be exciting and engaging, and are accessible on any device. Clear analytics are provided to both students and teachers to monitor progress, and flexible timing options are available for playing in real-time or for individual practice. The goal is to increase math fluency and scores, and to make learning math fun and easy.

Memby is a startup that offers online group lessons for students in Lithuania. Its mission is to make quality education accessible to everyone by offering online lessons at an affordable price, compared to private lessons. Memby features experienced and competent teachers to provide personalized learning to students. The aim is to help students improve their grades and prepare for exams in an interactive and engaging environment. Memby also provides access to class recordings for the students.

Giraffe360 is a property tech startup that provides 360° photography, floor plans, and virtual tours, which allows buyers and sellers to view properties from different angles and perspectives. This technology can save time and money for those who are looking to buy or sell properties as they do not need to physically visit each property. By using this service, people can view each property in detail without leaving their home, which is especially useful in today's pandemic-induced need for social distancing. Giraffe360's technology can provide an immersive and interactive property viewing experience.

The startup offers a service that creates 1:1 digital twins of actual live event tickets to engage users and provide them with actual utility at events. They bridge the existing ticketing and live event markets to web3 and provide additional opportunities for fan engagement throughout the event. Eikonoklastes Therapeutics is developing a gene therapy for the treatment of sporadic and familial Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), a devastating neurodegenerative disease with no effective treatment. They have received the FDA's Orphan Drug designation for their 1st-in-class treatment, which elevates neuroprotective proteins using adeno-associated virus (AAV)-mediated gene delivery that leads to healthier nerve cells and better communication between them. They are focused on using breakthrough medicines to treat diseases with the highest unmet clinical needs, and their lead indication is Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC). The company aims to accelerate the approval of multiple compounds to focus on accelerated approvals and outsized returns for them, mainly by targeting rare indications & molecules with breakthrough potential.

Kurome Therapeutics is developing therapies to target cancer cells that have coopted immune signaling pathways in order to avoid destruction by traditional therapeutic agents and subvert adaptive resistance mechanisms. The startup aims to subvert the cancer cells' adaptive resistance mechanism by inhibiting IRAK1 and IRAK4, which provide an overall survival benefit in MDS and AML cells by suppressing this adaptive resistance mechanism in naive and relapsed/refractory cancer. They have shown that inhibiting IRAK1 and IRAK4 suppresses the survival of cancer cells in different backgrounds. The aim is to provide an effective and beneficial therapy for those who have developed adaptive resistance. All rights reserved.

Airway Therapeutics is developing a new class of biologics AT-100, which is a novel recombinant human protein rhSP-D, to break the cycle of injury and inflammation for patients with respiratory and inflammatory diseases such as Bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD). BPD is a ventilation and infection-induced respiratory disease with 200,000 very preterm infants at risk in the US and about 2.5 million globally each year. AT-100 is used to reduce inflammation and infection while modulating the immune response to break the cycle of injury and inflammation. Airway Therapeutics has opened international clinical trial sites and treated the first patient in Spain in the phase 1B study of Zelpultide alfa (AT-100) in preterm infants at risk for Bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD).

This startup is providing developers and creators with an open video infrastructure protocol that allows them to easily add live and on-demand video experiences to their apps and social media platforms. Thesis has a strong focus on bridge the gap between bitcoin and real-world purchases, enabling private data on public blockchains and empowering people with privacy. This startup aims to solve the problem of creating lasting NFT experiences for brands. Async aims to solve the problem of providing a platform for innovative artists, musicians, and brands to tell powerful stories, collaborate, and plug into the wider ecosystem using Web3 capabilities. The platform offers a no-code art builder, drag-and-drop upload wizard, blend modes, mock renderer, audio/visual linking, collaborators, rarity control, and more. The goal is to enable creators to reimagine their work, build outstanding collaborative collections, and push the boundaries of digital art and music. Async empowers individual creators or large music labels with its unique capabilities, which are five to ten years ahead of everyone else. Its marketplace offers a space for publishing projects offering dynamic and interactive experiences for collectors. The startup's context is not related to user problems. It is a code snippet of a smart contract called Optimistic Governor that aims to allow optimistic governance of a set of transactions. The contract creates a proposal hash and adds transactions to that proposal, which can be challenged by anyone within a certain liveness period. CatalYm has received FDA IND clearance to expand the development of Visugromab, a therapeutic antibody targeting GDF-15, in advanced cancer patients in the US. They also closed a EUR 50 million series C financing to accelerate the Phase 2 clinical development of Visugromab in patients with solid tumors.

Tubulis aims to solve the problem of developing protein-drug conjugates for specific diseases by using proprietary technologies and disease-specific biology. They generate uniquely matched conjugates that have potential therapeutic benefits. The startup is using Twitter to increase its brand visibility and potentially attract investors or partners in the biotech industry. The tweets provide brief information about their products and services. Being an early adopter of Twitter, Tubulis is leveraging the platform's ability to disseminate information quickly and gain traction among its followers.

This startup, Features & Labels, provides two tools for running and orchestrating Python models with dbt (data build tool). These tools include dbt-fal, which enables building Python models that can be run with any data warehouse such as Redshift and Postgres. Another tool, fal CLI, helps in automating tasks such as sending Slack alerts from dbt project or loading data before a dbt run. The startup aims to help users easily run and orchestrate dbt Python models, making it easier to work with data warehouses.

The startup aims to provide an AI-powered platform to help startups to go to market faster. It offers machine learning, engineering and product development talent to match right hires with the startup. Cortical Ventures provides exclusive access to ODSC's network and events that help to showcase the startup. It brings depth and credible advice to every aspect of company building. The startup offers an unfair advantage to founders by combining human expertise and machine intelligence. Cortical Ventures is built by Operators and has experience, credibility, and trust as its most important assets.

Integration.app solves the problem of building and managing customer-facing integrations easily for developers. With a growing number of connectors, their AI-powered platform translates integration logic into specific data models and API calls for every relevant app, making integration faster and simpler. Integration.app also offers a user-friendly interface for developers to customize their integration scenarios with pre-built UI components or their own. Their platform takes care of all hard parts such as authentication mechanisms, rate limits, data formats, and structures, as well as error handling. Integration.app also provides comprehensive monitoring and troubleshooting tools for integrations, making it simpler for developers to troubleshoot their issues.

AICrete is a startup that offers a unique “concrete-recipe-as-a-service” model to the concrete and construction industry. The startup uses proprietary models and algorithms based on a customer’s objectives and raw materials data to optimize the concrete mix and reduce carbon emissions by up to 35%. AICrete's technology helps concrete producers double profitability. They provide a customized solution to concrete producers who ship samples of raw materials to AICrete's lab in California. Based on this, the startup optimizes the concrete mixtures in as little as a few days. By offering recipe-as-a-service, AICrete aims to bring better practices and technical expertise to the entire industry and power concrete producers to respond and improve the current supply chain issues.

Cortical Ventures aims to solve the problem of startups' hiring and finding the right talent to go to market faster. Their AiQ Talent Platform provides a unique matching technology to help startups connect with appropriate machine learning, engineering, and product development talent. They provide exclusive access to ODSC's network and events to showcase the startup's community development and boost its market reach. Cortical Ventures combines human expertise and machine intelligence to offer startups an unfair advantage utilizing AI, and they believe that AI is not just a buzzword but the future of the industry. They have experience in the field as they are built by operators who have learned through building, failing, and succeeding and are prepared to share their technical depth and credible advice to every aspect of company building.

Cortical Ventures is a venture capital firm that invests in startups developing products and technologies that will fundamentally advance the field of artificial intelligence (AI) to empower superior data-driven decisions that enhance people’s lives, businesses, and the world. The firm has launched with a $50 million AI-focused fund, and part of the proceeds raised by the concrete-mix startup AICrete and Immerok, which developed cloud products for real-time streaming data, will be invested towards expanding their teams and further developing their products. The firm has invested in hOS, an AI technology startup founded by the former CEO of DataRobot, and Neo Cybernetica, a stealth deep tech company. The goal of Cortical Ventures is to lead or co-lead pre-seed to Series A investments in startups that could revolutionize the AI industry.

The startup is solving the problem of time-consuming and complex financial planning and analysis (FP&A) for companies. They offer an end-to-end platform that uses automation and out-of-the-box machine learning to provide instant and accurate metrics reporting and analysis. It eliminates the need for manual processes such as spreadsheet formulas and board deck preparations. The platform also offers ML-driven forecasting, allowing businesses to plan for the future with a long-term perspective instead of just one quarter. Finally, it fosters collaboration among team members to drive strategic decision-making based on the automated insights and reports.

Cortical Ventures is a venture capital firm focused on investing in companies that develop products and technologies to advance the field of AI and empower superior data-driven decisions that enhance people’s lives, businesses, and the world. They invest in AI-focused startups and incubate or co-create companies partnering with top engineering talent. Cortical Ventures has launched a $50M inaugural fund which they plan to use to invest in AI innovators. They have invested in hOS, a startup focused on AI technology, and AICrete, a startup focused on automating concrete production. Their goal is to invest in AI companies that have potential to lead the AI revolution.

Startup aims to solve the problem of developing and deploying applications in the cloud without worrying about underlying infrastructure. They provide ultra-fast performance, fault tolerance, elasticity, and data connectivity, and their built-in SQL editor helps to create real-time applications for security, IoT, analytics, machine learning, and more. Using Apache Flink, a standard framework for stream processing, they provide an integrated solution for stateful stream processing and streaming analytics at scale, making it easier for enterprises to receive real-time insights from their data. Their Ververica Cloud provides a fully-managed cloud-native service for real-time data processing, enabling users to deploy and manage Flink apps seamlessly. Their goal is to simplify streaming app development and make data processing faster and easier.

The startup is solving the problem of helping other startups go to market faster and gain an unfair advantage by providing them with a unique AiQ Talent Platform that matches them with machine learning, engineering, and product development talent to ensure they get the right hires in place quickly. They are developing proprietary decision analytics and machine learning models to support their startup's growth. They offer exclusive access to ODSC's network and events to help showcase startups and boost their own community development. Additionally, they bring depth and credible advice to every aspect of company building, which is an unfair advantage for the startup. Finally, they offer experience and credibility, built by operators who learned from building, by failing and succeeding, so trust is their most important asset.

Coiled is a startup that offers a way for data scientists and engineers to use the cloud efficiently and effectively without spending weeks reading documentation. Their product Dask empowers the users to run Python at scale in the cloud. Coiled manages Dask for the users in their cloud, breaking up big problems into little ones, and running that work on distributed hardware. The users can use Python for a lot of different things from for loops to pandas and PyTorch. Coiled offers Trusted setup, easy to use, cost-efficient, safe, and secure services for companies and individuals. By using the Coiled service, users can finish their long-term computational efforts in an afternoon.

Immerok is solving the problem of real-time stream processing for applications at any scale, by providing a fully managed Apache Flink cloud service. Their serverless solution offers cloud-native scaling and resilience, removing operational overhead for the customer. They also provide recipes and resources for handling events that arrive past the watermark time setting, ensuring data is captured efficiently. Immerok is a leading contributor to the development of Apache Flink, a popular open source stream processing framework. Their services aim to make powerful real-time data processing accessible and manageable for businesses.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The GeneSight test provided by Myriad Neuroscience aims to solve the problem of finding effective medication and avoiding side effects, by analyzing a patient's genetic makeup to determine which medications may require dose adjustments, may be less likely to work, or may have an increased risk of side effects. This information is then given to the clinicians to help them make informed decisions about the treatment of their patients. GeneSight test focuses on psychiatric medications and analyzes genetic variations that may impact how a patient metabolizes and responds to them. The company offers a range of resources for both patients and clinicians, including patient stories, clinical studies, healthcare provider stories, and white papers. Myriad Neuroscience is a business unit of Myriad Genetics that specializes in pharmacogenomic testing.

AuditBoard is a startup that helps enterprise businesses integrate and manage their audit, risk, ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance), and compliance processes. Their platform enables users to connect their teams and stakeholders to existing and emerging risks, allowing them to make strategic decisions. AuditBoard's goal is to help their customers increase their teams' efficiency, effectiveness, and impact. They use an intuitive and integrated platform that focuses on the risks and opportunities most relevant to their clients' businesses and strategic objectives. AuditBoard is trusted by more than 40% of Fortune 500 companies to provide clarity, agility, and resilience to their business ventures.

LegalZoom aims to provide access to independent attorneys and self-service tools for entrepreneurs, businesses, and individuals who need legal help but don't want to spend large amounts of money on hourly rates and office visits of a traditional law firm. The startup offers flat-rate fees and a refund on their charges for unsatisfied customers within the first 60 days of use. It provides a range of services, from business formation to wills and trusts, and intellectual property registration. LegalZoom's goal is to make legal help accessible, affordable, and straightforward for everyone. Therefore, it solves the problem of expensive legal services that many businesses and people may not be able to afford.

Clearbit solves the problem of inefficient lead management for businesses by providing a platform that allows for real-time scoring, routing, and analytics of lead data, which can be instantly sent to the company's CRM. This ensures a frictionless buyer experience and a fast-track for prospects to become clients, increasing the efficiency of the company's revenue engine. Clearbit's platform also provides market, sales, and lead intelligence that gives businesses clarity on every new and existing customer record and allows for combining and sending data to the relevant tools. Additionally, Clearbit's platform reveals hidden pipeline opportunities, enabling businesses to achieve hyper-growth.

Scopely is a startup that focuses on developing game experiences that foster community, connection, competition, and play every day. The company aims to expand the possibilities of play by providing new game experiences to its users. Scopely has a wide range of games in its ecosystem that offers different gameplays and themes. The startup encourages people who share the same passion for games to join them for a vibrant life at Scopely. They provide a safe and respectful community for people to connect, compete and have fun.

Carrum Health is a healthcare startup that offers a value-based Centers of Excellence platform for employers and their employees in the USA. It negotiates directly with healthcare providers to provide upfront bundled payments to the clients to reduce their costs and provide quality care. Carrum Health claims that its innovative approach can save employers up to 45% per procedure and reduce medical bills for patients. Their unique approach helps patients in receiving appropriate care that is better, less expensive, and easier for everyone. It solves the problem of high medical expenses and lack of quality care for patients.

Looker aims to solve the problem of inefficient data management and analysis for businesses, by providing a comprehensive and customizable platform for data-driven workflows. With Looker's embedded analytics solutions, users can access fresh and reliable data to infuse new insights into their tools. It also supports multiple data sources and deployment methods, as well as various SQL dialects to avoid database lock-in and maintain multicloud data environments. Looker's modern BI and analytics can help businesses operate efficiently with real-time dashboards and integrated insights. Its goal is to help companies find power in their data while maintaining choice in their data stack.

Care.com is a platform that provides various services, such as child care, senior care, pet care, tutoring, and housekeeping. They also offer a service called Care.com HomePay, which helps individuals find appropriate caregivers that comply with the applicable laws. However, Care.com does not employ caregivers and is not responsible for their behavior or conduct. All information provided on the site is created by users and not verified by Care.com. They provide extensive resources to help users find local caregivers across the world.

The startup offers purpose-built solutions that streamline supply chain operations to improve efficiency, reduce waste, and operate sustainably, helping companies to overcome market volatility and capture growth opportunities. It also minimizes the administration, risk, and cost of cross-border filing for global trade, simplifies tendering, optimizes capacity and payments to drive efficiency across all modes of transportation, and puts the channel to work by leveraging decision-grade data and improving partnership performance. Its platforms enable end-to-end supply chain visibility and collaboration, featuring actionable views, and integrated workflows that break down traditional information and decision-making silos. The company caters to a global customer base across different industries, including aerospace and defense, automotive, consumer packaged goods, food and beverage, freight carriers, high-tech, retail, and telecoms, among others.

MedManage is a medication management system that helps patients and caregivers manage multiple medications making it easier and simpler by allowing common tasks that are often done manually or from memory such as managing and logging medication history and adherence by providing a digital platform. It has two important features, keeping a digital record of medication adherence which can provide useful information to healthcare providers, and serving as a useful reminder and management tool for medication intake. MedManage also provides a way to keep up-to-date medical records at the user's fingertips. In addition, it also offers medication tracking, and dosage reminders, and a medication reminder service. Its users testify that MedManage has helped them in managing their medications whether it's remembering, storing, sharing, or logging.

OpGen, along with its subsidiaries, Curetis and Ares Genetics, develop and commercialize molecular microbiology solutions that help improve patient outcomes by providing clinicians with rapid and actionable information about life-threatening infections. Their product portfolio includes the Unyvero System and multiplex syndromic panels, Acuitas AMR Gene Panel and Acuitas Lighthouse, and the ARES Technology Platform including ARESdb, which uses next-generation sequencing technology and AI-powered bioinformatics solutions for antibiotic response prediction. Their innovative approaches to infectious disease diagnostics help guide antibiotic therapy selection, improve antibiotic stewardship, and decrease the spread of multidrug-resistant microorganisms (MDROs) to address the global threat of antimicrobial resistance (AMR).

They have a tested process designed to help their portfolio companies accelerate their growth by effectively leveraging the DVC team's network and insights. They have invested in Naya Ventures portfolio company Motivity Labs which merged with JNIT. This move represents the fifth exit strategy for Naya Ventures.

The startup is a venture fund that invests in technology-focused companies specializing in AI/ML, IoT, XR and other emerging technologies. Their investment philosophy centers around guiding business development, product, and technology strategy for their portfolio companies through ‘DVC Advantage’ to achieve successful outcomes. Startup aims to provide critical sales intelligence on future infrastructure projects to businesses in the water, wastewater, and transportation industries. Their data sources include a variety of public documents and data generated by cities, utilities, and public agencies such as municipal budgets, council meeting minutes, master plans, and environmental regulatory reports. Additionally, it helps its clients comply with regulatory requirements and seamlessly manage their health management programs.

Lucy is a startup that offers an AI-powered Enterprise Search Answer Engine that empowers coworkers to find answers with ease, freeing up valuable time and boosting organizational productivity. Their unique ability called Lucy Synopsis allows Lucy to join the conversation on communication channels such as Teams or Slack. They efficiently unify access to information across existing internal systems using effortless integrations and automate data indexing. Lucy ensures users always have access to the most up-to-date information, eliminating the need for uploading. Lucy ends the daily scavenger hunt for information, allowing time to be spent driving forward the priorities that matter to the business.

DVC is a venture capital firm that helps startups in their journey from seed stage to series A and beyond by evaluating their proposal through their DVC Quick process. They help startups in finding their product-market fit, creating a growth roadmap, and identifying any financial, legal, or operational risks. DVC also recognizes the importance of acquiring the first paying customer as validation of the startup's journey. Their goal is to transform the startup journey by providing startups with a faster decision making process that can give them a crucial head start in a competitive market, allowing them to concentrate on innovation and creation. In summary, DVC solves the problem of fundraising being a full-time role by itself for startups by providing them with a time-tracked and efficient process that can help them focus, scale, and exit.

AmplifAI is a startup that helps enterprise teams and BPOs drive performance enablement and optimize actions to replicate top performers. The company provides an AI-driven performance enablement platform that transforms data into optimal actions for frontline leaders, frontline teams, and enterprise organizations. AmplifAI allows companies to coach employees, develop frontline agents, measure coaching effectiveness, and improve agent retention, cost savings, employee experience, frontline productivity, and customer experience. The company has been recognized for its advanced performance enablement solutions and has helped some of its customers increase annual revenue, customer satisfaction, and agent and team lead productivity, while decreasing contact center operating costs.

Heartbeat Health is solving the problem of limited access to high-quality heart care. They are pioneering a virtual-first cardiology approach to revolutionize the cardiovascular care industry by using device connectivity and remote diagnostic data to make identifying and treating people with heart risk easier and more clinically effective. They offer on-demand services such as same-day diagnostic reads, televisits, and care programs using real-time clinical data and device connectivity to deliver their clinical offerings. They provide coordinated delivery and comprehensive care plans to ensure that patients receive the support they need to manage their heart health effectively. Heartbeat Health aims to break down the typically complex cardiovascular care path into discrete, digestible steps for patients and make heart care accessible from anywhere.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup Xeltis aims to solve the problem of heart and vascular disease through the development of innovative medical devices. They specialize in creating artificial heart valves, coronary bypass grafts, and hemodialysis access grafts that can help restore the function of damaged or diseased cardiovascular tissues. These devices are designed to be biocompatible and to integrate with the body's natural healing processes, reducing the risk of adverse reactions or complications. With the help of Xeltis implants, patients with heart and vascular disease can potentially regain their health and quality of life, without the need for more invasive procedures or medications.

Their digital ACP platform allows patients, loved ones, and care providers to have access to patient wishes, therefore removing the uncertainty from challenging healthcare encounters. The startup solves the user problem of multichannel selling and managing multiple platforms with one warehouse management software. The startup OndaVia offers a portable instrument and analyte-specific, consumable cartridges that allow for field-based analysis of key contaminants in the parts-per-billion range. This technology uses Surface-Enhanced Raman Spectroscopy (SERS) to quickly and easily detect specific contaminants, providing laboratory-quality results in minutes. The startup's goal is to enable decisive actions through definitive results, allowing for real-time decisions for process control, waste-water monitoring, site surveys, or pollution detection. OndaVia's technology is sensitive and selective, with detection capabilities down to the parts-per-billion level for specific contaminants. Their Analysis System allows for fast, easy, and do-it-yourself chemical analysis for a wide range of compounds.

80 Acres Farms is a startup that solves the problem of providing fresh, pesticide-free food to customers. Aurora is solving the problem of slow transaction processing and high transaction costs for Ethereum developers by providing layer-2-like speed and scalability. Aurora ecosystem provides a platform for developers to build blockchain applications that can benefit from faster transaction processing and affordable costs. The Aurora ecosystem has already attracted many projects that are taking advantage of its scalability and speed.

Kresko is solving the problem of providing a one-stop DeFi app for managing assets that allows people to trade synthetic stocks, commodities and crypto easily, with low fees, and without complexity. They want to make wealth creation accessible to anyone, anywhere, regardless of technical knowledge, and incentivize long-term behavior through their capital efficient protocol. Kresko also offers the ability to trade in fractional assets and the opportunity for integration with third-party apps and wallets through their Compose program. Fordefi aims to solve the problem of managing DeFi protocols securely with granular controls for different workflows. It offers a policy engine that enables users to manage their own policies and controls while having balance between flexibility and security. The platform also provides institutional-grade security with multiple layers of protection such as MPC key management, cryptographic authorization, and hardware isolation. Users can monitor their portfolio, manage assets and vaults, and review transactions and risk alerts on one unified platform. The startup has collaborated with industry leaders and aims to make DeFi accessible to institutions with the highest levels of security.

The startup is solving the problem of providing a platform for building and experimenting with interchain-native apps and smart contracts, along with providing a community for discussions, open-source codes, and governance. They are providing a leading decentralized exchange that allows for swapping, earning, and building with interchains. EigenLayer aims to solve the user problems of low-latency settlement chains, MEV management, decentralized sequencers, and data availability by allowing ETH restakers to stake their tokens as cryptoeconomic security for protocols other than Ethereum. They can participate in ZK proof verification off-chain, and certify that proofs are correct on-chain. EigenLayer enables a larger collateral pool to certify stateroots, and Ethereum validators who are block proposers and opted in to restaking can provide strong guarantees on inclusion of event-driven actions, at the risk of getting slashed. EigenLayer allows restaked sidechains where ETH restakers can participate in new consensus protocols which have low latency and high throughput. Finally, it allows for the creation of a hyperscale Data Availability (DA) layer, with a high DA rate and low cost.

Gitcoin aims to solve the problem of funding for open-source and impact-oriented projects. It offers a platform for people and communities to manage and grow their grants program, allocate funding, and support projects easily and securely. Gitcoin Grants Stack allows for an easy, end-to-end solution for launching and growing a community-driven grants program where Program Managers, Project Owners, and Supporters can launch and participate in funding opportunities. It also provides identity management solutions like Gitcoin Passport, which allows people to create a digital identity, prove their humanity, and build a trustworthy reputation without storing personally identifiable information. Gitcoin Sybil defense tool protects community members and shared resources and combats Sybil attackers. Overall, Gitcoin has helped fund more than 3,715 projects with over $50 million going towards public goods over the past five years.

Saddle is a DeFi platform that allows users to swap, stake and earn different tokens with a clear user interface in the dApp. The platform boasts over $2.2B cumulative volume, $11M TVL, and 3,000 token holders. Saddle allows for completely trustless on-chain voting and features community pools, cross-chain gauges, and the option to create a pool. The Saddle Community is active and vibrant with a weekly Space on CT and various social media connections. Saddle has partnerships with reputable protocols and prioritizes collaboration. The Saddle platform is run by veSDL holders with direct governance over the flow of weekly SDL emissions. Saddle allows for users to build the future of DeFi through participation in forums, Snapshot, and gauges.

Certora provides formal verification technology for smart contract developers to ensure security and code excellence. Its technology analyzes EVM bytecode using abstract interpretation and constraint solving to reinforce key mechanisms and simulate adversary attacks. The company has worked with various mission-critical fintech startups, such as Aave, Balancer, Notational Finance, and Stakehouse Protocol. Certora has verified the security of contracts for diverse blockchain platforms and protocols, including Celo Core Contracts, Orchid's Smart Contracts, Compound’s Open-Oracle with Uniswap Anchor, dForce Lending Protocol, and Synthetix Multi-Collateral Loans. The company's expertise helps smart contract developers to enhance code quality, generate test cases, and prove that specific contracts are correct, allowing them to develop high-quality software amid ever-increasing market competition.

The Octopus Network is a multichain cryptonetwork that allows developers and founders to launch and run Substrate-based, EVM compatible, application-specific blockchains, also known as appchains, in a secure and interoperable environment. The network provides a substrate development training program to support developers in enhancing their protocol development. It aims to ignite the network effects necessary for the success of the Web3 builders by creating a rich Web3 ecosystem to explore, accelerate, and join. The applications developed on Octopus Network is secured with its robust infrastructure and can be registered by web3 teams to the Appchain Communities in the Octopus & NEAR Ecosystems. Additionally, the network offers an accelerator program for developers and founders to jump-start their Web3 projects from idea to testnet, with opportunities for community, staking and funding.

Marlin Foundry is a startup that aims to solve the problem of slower block confirmations, high gas fees, and slow transaction times in blockchain technology. To solve this, they have created a high-performance communication network that allows distributed networks to work in tandem, ensuring higher throughput, lower confirmation times, and optimized topologies for faster delivery. One of the key technologies in achieving this is Metanodes, which incentivize node operators to relay packets and ensure faster transmission speeds in exchange for fees. By creating a network of programmable routers, Marlin Foundry allows users to launch their own Chaumian mixnet, VPN, relay network, anonymity network or mesh network securely, allowing for flexible incentivization and extensible architecture.

Yoz Notifications is a web3 notification system designed by developers for developers that aims to save time, streamline development and reach users on their preferred channels. The system is in private beta and is tailored for hassle-free configuration, allowing developers to use on-chain events to trigger custom alerts for users. Yoz Notifications offers multi-channel delivery that can be easily integrated with existing messaging apps. The interface is simple, providing a built-in subscribe dialog where no SDK is required, enabling users to receive notifications where they want to. The system offers delivery conversion, error detection, and subscriber insights features, and has various use cases, including protocol participation, and giving collectors the edge with notifications.

Startup aims to solve the problem of user-controlled identity and data across all digital interactions. Their goal is to unbundle the login experience to provide user control, data sharing, and faster innovation. They are building an open-source stack to leave control of identity and data where it should be: with users. Their mission is to build a future where users control their identity and data across all digital interactions.

This startup offers a platform for trading perpetual contracts with no fees and up to 20x more buying power, and it is accessible through its website and mobile app. They provide deep liquidity, fast trades execution, and the ability to withdraw funds from Layer 2 without any wait time. Their platform is built on Starkware's Layer 2 solution, which offers increased security and privacy through zero-knowledge rollups. This startup is solving the problem of restricted access to decentralized financial tools by providing an open and powerful platform that anyone can use.

BEGiN aims to reimagine early learning and provide kids with the best possible start at ages 2-10. The startup aims to solve the problem of minimizing the risks of error and fraud for businesses involved in extending their lines of credit by offering their Lending & Risk Analytics product. The startup offers a platform that provides easy integrations to scale financial features such as account opening, payments, cards, credit, and more. The startup aims to be an indispensable tool for freelancers and solo entrepreneurs who want to streamline their operations and provide the best customer experience possible.

It offers a personalized learning journey for children based on their unique interests, age, and current learning level. The program is designed by experts and backed by research, featuring a four-step approach that goes beyond rote memorization to build confidence, promote problem-solving, and foster a lifelong love of learning. HOMER teaches reading, math, social and emotional learning, thinking skills, and creativity through lessons and activities that kids love, resulting in an increase in early reading scores by 74%. The program is ad-free, safe, and easy for kids to use, and it provides offline activities and printables as well as resources and tips from learning experts.

Aescape aims to offer massage therapy on-demand, ensuring that the client receives treatment when and where they want, on their terms. The company has a team of investors from various backgrounds in robotics, AI, SaaS, sports, hospitality, and beyond who are committed to supporting Aescape in their ambition to revolutionize the health and fitness industry for the better. There is no information about any particular pain point that Aescape is addressing beyond the need for people to prioritize their physical and mental wellbeing in a busy world.

The goal of the company is to serve a diverse customer base with no prior credit history requirements to qualify for their loans.

It puts all shipment and PO data in one place, removing the need to check multiple forwarder and carrier systems for updates. Beacon uses live ETA tracking at a PO and container level, aggregating the latest data through direct carrier and port integrations to provide up-to-date information whenever needed. Additionally, Beacon combines supply chain finance with technology to find the most cost-effective shipping routes.
