startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Qualifi aims to solve the problem of long and time-consuming hiring processes and biased recruitment procedures for recruiters. Their audio-based platform enables recruiters to phone screen multiple candidates simultaneously, which accelerates the hiring process, particularly for high-volume recruiting efforts, resulting in faster time-to-hire. Through Qualifi's platform, recruiters can vet seven times more candidates per day on average, making the recruitment process more convenient and accessible. Qualifi captures rich, actionable data so that recruiters can make the best hiring decisions without bias and scale their efforts with integrations to more than 30 of the top Applicant Tracking Systems. Qualifi's mission is to reduce the time, effort, and bias involved in the recruitment process.

The startup is an investment fund called Flywheel Fund which exists to fund early-stage and tech-driven startups based in Indiana. They evaluate companies based on three primary factors, team, market, and product, and prioritize companies that can scale quickly. They offer monthly mentoring to startups from startup veterans, help with finding resources, solving problems, and sorting out operations and strategy. They actively seek out diverse founders and portfolio companies to build diverse leadership teams. In-person office hours are available every Thursday from 9:30-11:30 am at The Mill.

Folia is a digital collaboration platform that helps organizations share and collect valuable information from different sources while allowing team insights in real-time. Its ability to track comments revision across versions also appeals to creative fields such as screenwriting and design. Folia solves the challenge of building shared knowledge, which is becoming more challenging due to remote work. The investment of $2 million seed round led by IU Ventures will allow Folia to expand their marketing, sales, and development teams and engage more companies in the paperless movement. Folia's iAnnotate tool already has more than a million users across different sectors such as education, legal, and finance.

Flywheel Fund is a startup program that is administered by The Mill, a non-profit organization that provides entrepreneurship and coworking services in Bloomington. They offer in-person office hours on Thursdays from 9:30-11:30 am, and interested individuals can schedule an appointment through their website. Flywheel also encourages startups to explore The Mill's website to learn more about their events, competitions, and mentoring services. The organization aims to provide startup programming and support to entrepreneurs in Bloomington and help foster a thriving startup ecosystem in the area.

startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The startup described in the context is The Bee Corp.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The Bee Corp aims to address the problem of accurately assessing the strength and pollination value of honeybee colonies in a non-invasive manner. Beekeepers can use The Bee Corp's agritech solution Verifli, which uses infrared imagery to measure hive strength without opening it, to reduce labor costs associated with sorting hives before pollination and prove the value of their bees to negotiators. This technology is applicable not only to California almond farmers but to numerous other crops such as berries, apples, and avocados that also rely on bees for pollination. The $50,000 investment from Flywheel Fund is part of a $1 million round that will be used to hire key roles and scale the technology to new, unserved markets. The Bee Corp aims to provide growers and farmers with more data to improve their fields and support them through continuous technology advancements.

Flywheel Fund invests in early-stage Indiana-based tech startups and provides them with a network of support, early-stage investment, and outstanding mentoring. They have invested in various startups such as ProBook Sports, Stagetime, Civic Champs, Boost, Qualifi, Flowaste, Flamel.ai, Ziptility, rScan, Modicus Prime, GeoH, HeARsight, Wave Therapeutics, Chuqlab, Celadore, Finniva, Quiptu, SecondSight, NearWave, The Utiliz, and Laxis. Through their investment, they aim to help startups solve various problems such as providing an end-to-end platform for coaches to engage with their team members, automating volunteer management for non-profits, helping students manage deadlines, providing technology for conducting high volumes of phone interviews, providing data analytics for actionable insights on food waste, simplifying the process of selling returned merchandise online, providing intelligent image analysis of biologics, streamlining management and onboarding of caregivers and patients, developing augmented reality glasses for hearing ability-independent speech comprehension, enabling the processing of thousands of hours of audio and video files for solving crimes, making a non-invasive imaging device for breast cancer detection and monitoring, providing insight into pipeline assets to help plan for and predict changes in water infrastructure needs, and providing a Dynamic Strategic Planning platform.

startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The name of the startup described in the context is Folia.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Flywheel Fund invests in early-stage Indiana-based tech startups and provides them with a network of support, outstanding mentoring and matchmaking with investors, founders, and tech enthusiasts. They have invested in startups from various industries such as utility operations, healthcare scheduling, AI-generated marketing, peer-to-peer rental marketplaces, and more. The portfolio companies provide solutions to different problems such as reducing food waste and costs, optimizing pollination quality for beekeepers and growers, improving workplace productivity while reducing environmental and economic costs, and providing an AI personal meeting assistant. Flywheel Fund aims to support innovative and promising startups in the state and help them grow.

Startup aims to solve the problem of providing pre-seed and seed funding to early-stage, tech-driven startups based in Indiana, while also offering mentoring from experienced startup veterans and connections to venture capitals. They focus on evaluating the team, market, and product to see which company can scale quickly, often requiring the CEO or a majority of the leadership team to live in Indiana. They have a simple voting system where members of the startup community vote up or down. They also prioritize diversity and building diverse leadership teams in their portfolio companies. In-person office hours are held every Thursday from 9:30-11:30 am at The Mill for entrepreneurs to discuss their startups.

Stagetime is solving the problem faced by performing arts industry professionals who need a networking platform to connect with agents, composers, and others in the industry. It offers networking benefits that allow industry professionals to build connections in the industry. The platform uses dynamic multimedia portfolios that showcase artistic talent and experience, which sets it apart from traditional resume formats commonly used on other networking platforms like LinkedIn. Stagetime is also developing a new casting tool set to launch in spring 2022, aimed at supporting industry professionals in planning for future talent needs. Finally, Stagetime secured a $75,000 followed-on investment from Flywheel Fund, which is expected to help it refine the platform and gain more users.

FloWaste is a startup that aims to reduce landfill and greenhouse gases by leveraging business interests to serve a higher purpose. The food industry is facing a surge of interest in sustainability issues, and FloWaste has found a way to solve the problem. FloWaste uses cameras and machine learning to track food-related data at workstations, production lines, and trash cans. They provide data and analytics to help industrial and commercial food processors, cafeterias, quick-service restaurants, and other customers identify patterns in food waste to target. The startup is making a sustainable future and providing significant financial, environmental, and ethical returns for food producers.

startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The name of the startup is Flywheel Fund.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup name: Flywheel Fund The startup is a venture capital firm that invests in other startups. They have participated in seed and series raises for various companies, such as Folia and Qualifi. They have also invested in The Bee Corp, which offers an agritech solution for measuring honeybee colony strength. Flywheel Fund provides funding and support to these startups in order to help them succeed. They have an in-person office where people can make appointments to meet with them, and they also offer an email list for people to subscribe to. The startup aims to help both investors and founders navigate the startup world and achieve success.

Invoke Learning provides solutions to the higher education institution for improving student enrollment, engagement, retention, and DEI. They leverage artificial intelligence to provide personalized data insights to help colleges and universities navigate and address challenges related to the student journey. They estimate that the higher ed market spends over $155 billion annually to address student success issues, such as diversity, equity, and inclusion. Invoke Learning helps in facilitating improved results and predicting student success by measuring stress and anxiety levels for each individual student on a daily basis. They have raised just over $2 million to date, signed 18 colleges and universities, and secured partnerships with Google, Snowflake, and others.

The Flywheel Fund is a venture capital firm that aims to increase diversity in the VC hiring funnel by providing opportunities to students and young professionals from underrepresented backgrounds to gain early experience and exposure in VC with their firm as interns. Their goal is to become Indiana's center of gravity for entrepreneurship. They are committed to being a center for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. The firm has a diverse set of board members who represent technology and innovation-driven companies. The firm is focused on launching and accelerating startups.

Flywheel Fund is a venture capital providing early-stage funding for Indiana-based tech companies that have a product already in the market and have at least a few customers. They look at three factors when evaluating startups: team, market, and product. Their investment ranges from $100K to $1.5M, and they ask companies to commit to building a diverse team. Flywheel Fund aims to help shape operations and strategy for startups and care deeply about diversity in not only the founders they fund but also in their portfolio companies’ leadership teams. After investment, they mentor the CEO for the first year and periodically thereafter.

Motorq provides a connected vehicle data platform that helps fleet managers to get valuable insights from their fleets' data without requiring any dongles. The platform offers various features such as preventive maintenance, tracking ordered vehicles, identifying which ICE vehicles can be replaced by EVs, reimbursing EV drivers, safer driving with in-vehicle coaching, and eliminating fuel fraud with Fuel EKG™. Motorq synthesize data from all sources and provides the users with real-time information with an easy-to-use customizable web application. Their data lake stores the fleet data in a snowflake instance enabling users to access as much or as little data they like. Motorq's API helps in building custom integrations into the existing workflow or developing new applications. The goal of Motorq is to help businesses with real business value from their fleet data.

The startup, GuardKnox, offers solutions to develop secure-by-design, high-speed firmware and software components for the automotive industry, enabling the next generation of software-defined vehicles. Their products are secure by design and seek to eliminate possible risks while maintaining flexibility and scalability for the software-defined vehicle and next-gen E/E architecture. They offer CommEngine, which is a solution that can speed up the move to next-generation centralized E/E architectures. This technology aims to reduce time-to-market through a dedicated developer tool suite. GuardKnox aims to accelerate the transition of the automotive industry to offer consolidated architecture with decoupled hardware and software to provide drivers with an immersive customized driving experience.

Autoniq is a startup that aims to provide vehicle pricing and evaluation services to help car dealers make informed decisions. The service offers a fast and accurate VIN scanner that allows dealers to instantly access information from various pricing guides, such as Black Book, Kelley Blue Book, and J.D. Power. Autoniq also provides detailed vehicle histories with CARFAX® or AutoCheck® integration. Its exclusive profit guide provides actual sale price, cost, and days-to-sell for consumers' local wholesale and retail markets. The startup aims to provide an easy and affordable one-stop-shop for car dealers looking to buy or sell vehicles without the need for extra hardware or software.

AutoProtect is a startup that aims to provide zero-effort auto protection to its customers by utilizing artificial intelligence and strategic partnerships. The founders of AutoProtect have extensive experience and success as repeat founders who have raised capital from top-tier VCs, built billion-dollar companies and exited successfully to Allstate, Groupon, and Ford. AutoProtect provides job opportunities for product managers, software developers, and business developers to work on modern infrastructure, data analytics, and partnerships with the biggest insurers and dealers in the country.

PureCars offers tech-driven solutions and unmatched data capabilities to help auto dealerships attract and convert more customers. With advanced advertising solutions, website merchandising, market analytics, and OEM partnerships including 17 major manufacturers with turnkey co-op and compliance, PureCars provides industry-leading marketing solutions to enhance dealerships' sales and ROIs. Additionally, PureCars offers agencies award-winning technology and service to expand their solutions portfolio and help their clients succeed. The company's goal is to empower dealerships with the best solutions and true partnerships to drive more sales at lower costs and grow market share. Overall, the startup is solving the problem of automotive dealerships lacking the resources, knowledge, and expertise to navigate the ever-evolving digital marketing landscape.

Outrider aims to solve the problem of making yard operations more sustainable by reducing the carbon footprint of logistics hubs. The use of automation on electric yard trucks can reduce emissions, making operations more environmentally friendly. They also prioritize safety by keeping onsite employees and truck drivers out of harm's way with autonomous vehicles. In addition, automation can improve efficiency, turn time, space utilization, and asset tracking. Outrider provides an integrated system composed of management software, autonomous vehicles, and site infrastructure, transforming yard operations to be more efficient, safe, and sustainable.

Clover Sport is a point of sale solution that centralizes operations for food and beverage leaders in the restaurant, sports & entertainment, and foodservice management sectors. The startup features a state-of-the-art software solution on enterprise-grade Clover hardware that provides NFC, EMV, E2E, and PCI compliance. Its solution adds value to customer experiences and helps businesses move beyond transactions with digital sales and loyalty programs. The omnicommerce experience helps businesses control operations at scale, take control of menus and manage operations from a single register to all locations and channels. The startup enhances fan experiences globally and streamlines stadium operations and aims to enable cashless experiences by partnering with multiple businesses in various sectors. Hence, Clover Sport is a solution that primarily aims to provide a comprehensive point of sale experience, enhance customer experience and help businesses of many different sectors control operations at scale.

Privacy4Cars aims to solve the issue of personal data being left on vehicles at auctions that can pose a threat to consumers' privacy and identity. The startup provides a fast, traceable, and cost-effective process to erase nonpublic personal information from various vehicle types consigned every day at auctions. They offer personal data deletion services to different players in the automotive ecosystem, such as auto finance, inspection companies, franchise dealers, and other remarketers. Moreover, the startup also complies with regulatory requirements to reduce liability, minimize risk, and generate additional revenue for their clients. Privacy4Cars' service helps in reducing legal and reputational risk and providing peace of mind and additional services to consumers.

Startup Aurora Labs is solving the problem of software vulnerability and complex software delivery in the automotive industry using its Vehicle Software Intelligence technology. The technology involves Line-of-Code Intelligence, Auto Validate, Auto Detect, and Auto Update, which ensures system compatibility, SW system change validation and safety testing, accelerates SW glitch detection, and offers AI-based OTA updates. Their technology also aims to reduce costs associated with software and hardware, while ensuring the best user experience. Partnerships with organizations such as Deloitte and NTT DATA further support the company's mission to introduce AI to SW management processes and provide solutions for the challenges faced in software-defined vehicles. Aurora Labs has also won the Merit Award for Automotive and Transportation and the Artificial Intelligence Excellence Award in 2023.
There is no information provided in this context to analyze what user problems the startup is solving.

The startup is solving the problem of transitioning to renewable energy sources. They use SolvoMetallurgy to design and implement sustainable extraction and refining methodologies of strategic metals essential for the production of clean hydrogen. The benefits of their technology are 99% lower CO2 emissions, 95% more energy efficiency, no toxic emissions, and near-zero water consumption. Their goal is to create a habitable and sustainable planet for future generations. The startup focuses on innovation and the heart of their technology is clean hydrogen produced through sustainable means.

Omni Design solves the problem of enabling the development of the world's most demanding System-on-Chips (SoCs) in different fields, such as 5G, networking, automotive, image sensors, AI, and IoT, by providing breakthrough technology for data converters and mixed signal IP cores. Their first silicon success delivery on time and excellent customer support makes the IPs integration seamless into the design, becoming a reality of mixed-signal SoCs. Their technology enables their customers to offer differentiated solutions that give them a substantial competitive advantage in various applications. Moreover, with their ISO 9001 certification, they demonstrate their commitment to quality and excellence in the semiconductor industry.

This startup aims to solve the problem of optimizing hub-and-spoke operations and short-haul logistics for retailers across North America. They offer to enhance inventory pooling across multiple locations, reduce labor costs, and provide contactless delivery. Their service focuses on moving goods from micro-fulfilment centers and dark stores in urban environments to pick-up points like brick-and-mortar retail stores and distribution centers. Additionally, they have formed partnerships with Isuzu and Walmart, launched an electrification strategy, and gone fully driverless in Arkansas. Their goal is to provide an efficient and effective logistics solution for retailers and help them meet the expectations of their customers.

Forge Innovation & Ventures is a startup that aims to solve the problem of turning innovative tech, product, or business ideas into successful and investable startups. They offer an incubator program that provides resources, knowledge, and support to entrepreneurs to accelerate their ideas to fruition. Their goal is to help turn great ideas into profitable businesses that have a positive impact on society.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Ambri is solving the problem of energy storage for grid-scale renewable energy. They have developed liquid metal battery technology that allows for longer storage times and does not require extensive cooling, fire suppression, or explosion prevention equipment like lithium-ion batteries. Their batteries provide lower CapEx and OpEx than lithium-ion batteries, while not posing any fire risk. Ambri batteries can deliver 4 to 24 hours of energy storage capacity to shift the daily production from a renewable energy supply, enabling grid-scale solar and wind farms to replace coal, oil, and natural gas peaker plants. Their technology is sustainable, reliable, safe, and can last for over 20 years.

Braven Environmental™ is aiming to solve the problem of global plastic waste management by offering a solution that can process nearly 90% of all plastics with its Braven Reactor Train™ technology. The Braven Reactor Train™ is a turn-key solution that reduces the carbon footprint of waste plastic management and production and is available immediately. The startup partners with businesses to break the devastating cycle of waste plastics and to give them a valuable second life. With its advanced technology, Braven is making headlines for its waste innovation and economic development efforts, and newly opened facilities are ready to process plastics in months, not years.

The Zero-Emission Heavy Machinery Company provides manufacturers of industrial equipment with more efficient, durable, precise, and eco-friendly technology to build better machines. The technology, called RISE, outperforms hydraulic systems on many points such as speed, force, efficiency, and durability. Rise™ Robotics, the company behind it, is open to collaboration with industry leaders in material-handling, off-highway and construction. The technology works smoothly in harsh conditions without using any fluid and can reduce actuation energy by 65% to 90% making it ultra-efficient regardless of the power source. RISE™Cylinder, the flagship product, is an electro-mechanical alternative to hydraulic systems.

The startup is offering low-carbon and zero-carbon hydrogen solutions to create a reliable, sustainable, and cost-effective hydrogen supply. They provide hydrogen production, transport, storage, and fueling solutions that are scalable and flexible enough to grow with their clients' demand. The startup produces affordable clean hydrogen locally and supplies it reliably when and where their clients need it. Their solutions are low-carbon and carbon-negative, meeting the sustainability goals of their clients. According to the Why Hydrogen? section of their website, hydrogen is a game-changer to decarbonize businesses.

Neocarbonix® Laboratories is a startup that provides eco-friendly energy storage solutions with high performance by using machine learning algorithms to customize target cell performance characteristics such as energy density and fast charge time. Neocarbonix® at the Core design reduces the overall cell cost by 27% and increases the cell level energy density by 35% through the use of a 3D nanoscopic carbon binding structure that eliminates PVDF binder and NMP solvent from the coating process. It also enables continuous fast charging with a minimum degradation of Li-ion energy cells enabling 80% charge in under 15 minutes in high energy density cells. The electrodes are easy to manufacture by using the standard roll-to-roll coating and calendering equipment, and can be quickly produced in today's factories. Neocarbonix® at the Core design achieves a long cycle life of high loading cathodes and silicon dominant anodes, achieving 1000 cycles. The startup aims to provide a flexible and scalable technology that can be used in batteries, ultracapacitors, Li-ion batteries, and solid-state batteries, making it an eco-friendly, high-performance, and cost-effective energy storage solution.

Skyryse aims to reduce and eventually eliminate general aviation fatalities. To achieve this goal, they provide technology that offers a significant improvement in aviation safety. They aspire to change the future of flight using this technology. Skyryse's tools and products are designed to provide peace of mind to their customers. Mark Groden, the founder and CEO of Skyryse, believes that they offer a unique technology that unlocks transportation in an unprecedented way.

OPAL Fuels is solving the problem of carbon emissions from the Class 8 trucking industry, which is one of the major contributors to global climate change. They produce low-carbon intensity renewable natural gas (RNG) by capturing harmful methane emissions from landfills and dairy farms at their source and purifying them to replace diesel and other high carbon intensity fossil fuels. The transportation industry can significantly reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions while saving costs by transitioning to RNG fuel, which is up to 50% cheaper than diesel. OPAL Fuels provides RNG at fueling stations across the US, offers RNG solutions to landfills and dairy farms, develops RNG projects, and is committed to building hydrogen fueling stations for future use. They also help their customers achieve their carbon-reduction goals and help accelerate the decarbonization process in the transportation industry.

OnePointOne aims to solve the problem of increasing human population and their health by transforming the way we nourish and heal them through vertical farming. They believe that doing nothing will cost us everything and the world needs to redefine how we produce plants. Their technology enables them to cultivate plants at scale under controlled environments, which helps to produce higher quality and more consistent crops. These crops are grown using fewer resources and less land than traditional agriculture, which promotes sustainability. Their ultimate goal is to unleash the power of plants on human health by revolutionizing plant quality and production.

Vestaron is addressing the problem of pesticide resistance in agricultural and ornamental crops by providing a sustainable and innovative solution through their peptide-based insecticides. Their peptides provide a desirable safety profile for workers, beneficials, and the environment while overcoming the existing resistance issues. Vestaron's mode of action targets the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor differently from any existing class of insecticides. Their products, such as Spear-T, offer quick and effective control of mite populations while still maintaining safety standards. Vestaron is empowering farmers to manage insecticide resistance through their sustainable integrated pest management solution.

The startup is solving the user problem of keeping surfaces clean from dirt and dust by providing silica-based coatings that incorporate their proprietary nano-structure technology. They offer Anti-Soiling, Solar Anti-Reflective, and a range of other products, including new ones that are in development. Pellucere's mission is to develop and manufacture advanced optical coatings that meet a wide range of energy and industrial needs. They are based in Houston, Texas, and can be reached via phone or email.

Breakthrough Technologies aims to improve water and energy sustainability in industrial processes while driving better business performance. Their patent-pending technology, ALI, helps improve cooling towers by recovering 90% of evaporating water and reducing the concentration of solid and liquid impurities. The technology is easy to install, involves no moving parts, and has minimal maintenance and operating expenses. By using this sustainable solution, businesses can reduce water loss, blowdown, and plume rise, as well as lower operating costs and decrease their need for water treatment chemicals. Breakthrough Technologies addresses the challenge of environmental stewardship in industrial processes and seeks to help businesses become more sustainable.

The startup aims to provide sustainable technologies to help companies achieve net-zero. Their CarbonFree SkyMine technology in San Antonio, Texas, allows investors to be part of a carbon-free future by investing in a sustainable future that aims to make a significant impact in making the planet a better place. Their investors consist of passionate people and companies who share the same values and vision of achieving a sustainable future. They offer a business model that can help achieve net-zero goals profitably and aims to take the solutions worldwide.

This startup aims to inform its website users about its use of cookies and explains what types of cookies they use. It gives the users the option to either accept or decline cookies and allows them to manage their cookie settings. The cookies they use include Strictly Necessary Cookies, which are essential for the website to function and allow the user to move around on it, and Analytics Cookies, which collect information about how the user interacts with the website to improve how it works. The website also provides a link for users to opt-out of Google Analytics tracking across all websites. The startup values the privacy of its users and provides information about how they collect their data and the purpose of such collection.

They aim to increase yield as well as metabolic pathway engineering to deliver crops with enhanced nutrition. Plastomics' technology makes product development simplified with precise trait insertion, easy trait stacking and significantly reduced complexity and time in the breeding cycle.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The startup, Constructor, provides an ecommerce product search and discovery platform that uses AI-powered machine learning to optimize business results for their customers by listening to customer inputs and providing personalized product results. It offers tools such as autosuggest, browse, collections, recommendations, quizzes and search that learns from every customer interaction to drive the metrics that matter most to the business. Constructor's algorithm goes beyond cohort personalization to re-rank results with advanced machine learning thereby presenting users with products specifically geared towards their online shopping habits, in real-time. The startup team claims to be commerce platform agnostic, and they continue to deliver impressive customer service to their customers. They offer a free service that demonstrates the value of their search and discovery service using customer data of interested businesses.

Huma.AI aims to provide powerful decision-making data, insights, and analysis for life science professionals using everyday language. It enables faster evaluation of product effectiveness for regulatory compliance and guiding product strategy. Huma.AI allows teams to quickly comprehend the competitive clinical trial landscape from multiple perspectives and gain vital knowledge concerning inquiries and feedback on their products. It also automates the process of reviewing and analyzing literature and post-market performance data for post-market surveillance. Overall, Huma.AI aims to enhance medical insights, clinical trial design, simplify RWD analysis, and automate post-market insight for its customers.

SafeBeat Rx is a startup that aims to expand access to remote patient monitoring and cardiac monitoring through its integrated technology. The startup offers services such as mobile cardiac telemetry, event monitoring, and health tracking through unique devices and algorithms designed to help clinicians quickly see the full picture without being buried in notifications. They also utilize automated artificial intelligence-based software to interpret ECG results and help manage treatment. With the goal of improving patient and clinician experience, SafeBeat Rx seeks to make healthcare more accessible through top-notch compliance and impact in remote care. The startup has received funding and recognition from various sources in the medical community and investors. SafeBeat Rx is solving the problem of limited access to inpatient care and expanding access to remote monitoring for a wider range of high-acuity patients, improving healthcare outcomes and reducing health disparities.

Volur's AI solution helps meat producers optimize carcass value, improve quality, consistency, and enhance sustainability through data-driven decisions. They use AI to empower meat processors with optimal sorting and cutting decisions leading to increased income and reduced costs in a sustainable manner. Volur's solution also helps satisfy demand, save time, and reduce carbon footprint with higher utilization of each carcass. JBS USA has implemented Volur's solution to maximize carcass value and ensure optimal use of each animal after a proof-of-concept agreement with promising results.

Mojo Vision has developed micro-LED display technology, which is the smallest and densest in the world, and can disrupt the $160B+ display industry. Micro-LEDs can deliver high-resolution, low power consumption, and bright and brilliant colors, making it the only technology that can satisfy the requirements of the AR/VR market. Mojo Vision started developing this technology in 2015 and has succeeded in creating proprietary high-performance micro-LEDs at incredibly small sizes. With this technology, Mojo Vision aims to enhance display quality and enable new AR/VR products, smart wearables, and more. Therefore, Mojo Vision's micro-LED technology solves the problem of enabling better and more efficient displays for AR/VR and other emerging product markets.

Sonavex has developed EchoGuide technology which includes two breakthrough solutions – EchoMark and EchoSure – that enable any member of the care team to collect arteriovenous fistula volumetric flow rate, diameter and depth information at the dialysis clinic to support maturation assessment. This technology is designed to make it easy for any healthcare provider to collect accurate data in a variety of settings. The goal is to provide true clinical and economic value to patients and health systems through the use of this technology. EchoMark and EchoSure are not currently commercially available for AV access use.

Blumind is a deep-tech startup that aims to transform the AI compute paradigm by providing an industry-leading power, latency, and cost. They have a proprietary semiconductor architecture that uses machine learning, precision signal processing, in-memory computation, and brain-inspired processing to solve key challenges of stability and reliability, high accuracy, and broad neural network support. The startup's technology can be applied in a wide range of edge applications, including automotive and industry 4.0, smart home and smart city, human and animal sensing. Blumind is a Canadian company and a member of ventureLAB, a silicon-focused technology incubator.

Accern is a startup that aims to extract valuable insights from unstructured text data in order to reduce risk and maximize performance. They offer a platform that includes pre-assembled data sources, pre-built taxonomies, and pre-trained NLP models that deliver accurate insights. They also allow customers to BYO data, tune taxonomies, and re-train models to optimize their use case and workflows. Accern's goal is to empower both citizen data scientists and data science teams to make better decisions, reduce risk, and spot opportunities. Their customers include major banks, hedge funds, and credit rating agencies, among others.

Startup Paperspace is providing a cloud-based platform to allow users to develop, train and deploy their AI applications without the need to set up their own cloud infrastructure. They offer pre-configured templates, infrastructure abstraction and job scheduling among other features while allowing users to scale instantly for their GPU requirements. The platform also provides automatic versioning, tagging and life-cycle management functionality to ensure full reproducibility and ease of collaboration. According to customer reviews, Paperspace is easy to use and provides a Cloud instance that just works. Paperspace has also been used by some of the most advanced organizations in the world.

DreamCraft aims to democratize game development by providing a platform that simplifies the game creation process for those who have a passion for it but lack programming or art skills. It offers a game editor with a high-level, event-driven framework that includes features such as multiplayer, cross-platform, performance, memory-usage, and publishing that anyone can build games on top of. The platform also provides a wide range of art assets to build a cohesive world and IP, including casual and cartoon-like art styles that appeal to a broad base of young audiences. DreamCraft's goal is to empower bright creators to realize their game-making visions and monetize them with less friction than any UGC platform or engine out there. They have raised $10 million in Series A funding to accelerate their growth and enable anyone to create, publish, and monetize video games.

The startup codeSpark Academy aims to solve the problem of children lacking programming skills even at an early age. They provide a proprietary game-making platform that enables kids to learn to code and develop STEM skills while enjoying fun games and challenges designed to deliver education and coding instruction in an entertaining way. Their games help children develop problem-solving abilities, logical thinking, creativity, persistence, and confidence, as well as fostering engagement in girls and closing the gender gap in STEM. The platform offers a word-free interface, perfect for girls and boys, and is led by experienced developers and Disney Imagineers. The startup offers a 7-day free trial and is subsidized for schools to make coding accessible to kids everywhere.

Subtle Medical's SubtleMR and SubtlePET solutions aim to expedite patient care for MRI and PET procedures, respectively. They use deep learning algorithms to reduce image noise and increase image sharpness, allowing for image acquisition times to be reduced by up to 60% in some cases. Through this, Subtle Medical aims to help healthcare providers increase workflow efficiency, scan more patients per day, reduce wait times, and create a better patient experience by reducing exam times. Additionally, the company's solutions aim to maintain diagnostic confidence even on sub-optimal and accelerated scans.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Aidoc is a healthcare startup that aims to solve the problem of accurate medical diagnosis by providing full body imaging AI software. They use intelligent guidance and continuous monitoring from their medical team to ensure integral care for partners' employees. Their technology helps detect and pinpoint critical anomalies for radiologists through deep learning and AI algorithms that analyze medical images and patient data. Their goal is to improve the accuracy of medical diagnosis, reducing the chances of misdiagnosis and improving patient outcomes.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Alida Bio is a startup that aims to create innovative technology for reading of the epitranscriptome. They work with pharmaceuticals, diagnostics, agricultural sciences, and other sectors to bring bespoke solutions to complex problems. Their technology has a wide range of applications, such as identifying new drug targets for cancer treatment, developing therapeutic RNA editing, improving the understanding of disease mechanisms, and delivering new diagnostics and treatment regimes. Alida Bio offers multiplexed target panels that reduce hands-on time and variability, provide RNA modification landscape and expression profile in a unified approach for correlative data analysis at a new scale, and accurately quantitate RNA modifications occurrence. They also provide end-to-end analyses for tailored solutions to research needs.

The startup aims to solve the problem of creating sustainable materials and therapies of the future by pioneering approaches for building entirely synthetic genomes and reprogramming the genetic code of living organisms for programmable polymer synthesis. They use their platform technologies to create virus-resistant organisms and turn living cells into sustainable biofactories. Their goal is to revolutionize the fields of synthetic biology and biotechnology by developing new ways of constructing and synthesizing genomes and polymers. They envision a future where sustainable materials and therapies are produced in an eco-friendly and efficient manner using their innovative technologies. The startup is named constructive.bio.

Switchback Systems is aiming to solve the four major pain points in the current DNA synthesis market: faster turnaround times, higher accuracy (sequence fidelity), lower cost, and guaranteed confidentiality. Their plug-and-play Switchback platform provides customers with a deployable benchtop DNA synthesis system that is unique, highly scalable, and revolutionary. It is designed to help scientists accelerate the Synthetic Biology Revolution and build a more sustainable future. Switchback Systems is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and is funded and supported by venture capital firms, including OMX Ventures, Vertical Venture Partners, and Ahren Innovation Capital. They are currently growing their team and looking for talented and dedicated individuals to contribute to the important and fun science and engineering that are being accomplished at Switchback Systems.

This startup aims to solve the problem of antibiotic resistance and improve antibiotic treatment selection for patients by providing accurate human physiology models. It also provides adaptive, scalable, and accurate simulations of human physiology for efficient and effective drug development. By replicating the dynamic nature of human physiology in test tubes, the startup, named SynthBiome, hopes to develop better drugs and treatment selection. The startup was co-founded by Marvin Whiteley, PhD of Georgia Tech.

The startup provides a nanovial-based platform called Partillion technology for analyzing and sorting single cells based on secreted proteins using the instruments the researchers already have. This technology helps researchers in conducting life science research and therapeutic discoveries by providing them with a simplified solution for powerful single-cell assays. It allows scientists to screen 10,000-1,000,000 cells per experiment without acquiring new equipment at 100X lower cost per cell than legacy and microfluidic approaches. Additionally, the cells remain viable enabling more downstream experiments, and their Biotinylated Nanovials serve as a flexible platform for initiating discoveries. The startup has an award-winning technology and has won the Top New Product Award at SLAS 2022.

Celletto™ is a gene delivery technology platform developed by Basilard Biotech that aims to address the bottleneck in the engineering of many cell and gene therapies due to the high cost, lag time, and supply chain limitations associated with viral vectors. The technology uses a more cost-effective and versatile mechanical approach to gene delivery, called mechanoporation, which is designed to reduce costs and increase efficiency and safety compared to prevailing biological delivery methods. Celletto™'s key differentiators include single-site poration, nuclear delivery, massive parallelization, rapid cell processing, and simplified operation. The startup is solving the problem of inefficient and wasteful spending on Amazon PPC campaigns for Amazon sellers who lack knowledge or experience in digital advertising. startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The name of the startup is T1D Fund.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The JDRF T1D Fund is a venture philanthropy fund focused on investing in companies developing life-changing solutions to cure, prevent, and treat type 1 diabetes (T1D). The fund is a unique philanthropic vehicle that operates like a venture capital fund, providing a high-impact, high-leverage opportunity for philanthropists interested in the T1D mission. Donors contribute a minimum of $500,000 over four years and benefit from 501(c)(3) donation status, associated tax benefits, and full access to management and governance groups. All returns on the fund's investments are recycled back into the T1D mission. The fund takes 100% concentration risk in drugs, diagnostics, platforms, devices, and other health solutions with application to T1D. The fund leverages philanthropic capital to build a portfolio of investments that are attractive to financially motivated investors and compelling to the T1D community.

The startup Kriya Therapeutics aims to revolutionize the gene therapy industry by developing and manufacturing gene therapies with the potential to transform the treatment of a broad range of diseases, while reducing the cost and accelerating the speed of development of new therapies and technologies. They rely on a proprietary computational engine, in-house manufacturing infrastructure, and integrated design platform to achieve their goals. Their mission is to expand the reach of gene therapy to a broad range of diseases. There is no information provided in the context on how Kriya Therapeutics is solving any specific user problems.

startup_name_in_which_venture_capital_fu: The startup described in the context is the T1D Fund, which is a venture philanthropy fund focused on equity investments in companies developing life-changing Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) products.
startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: The T1D Fund is a venture philanthropy fund that invests in products and therapies for people with type 1 diabetes and those at risk of developing it, to lead a more normal and longer life. They approach investment opportunities slightly differently than either a venture capital fund or a non-profit organization. All the companies they invest in must have or be developing a T1D program with significant potential for clinical impact. They invest across a spectrum of T1D approaches and do not differentiate in the kind of technology that they invest in, so long as it’s transformational and T1D-focused. Their investments and investors are not limited to the U.S. but are from across the global community.

The startup Bigfoot Biomedical is offering the Bigfoot Unity Diabetes Management Program, a real-time partner to healthcare providers to help support their patients using multiple daily injections (MDI) of insulin regimens. The centerpiece of the program is the Bigfoot Unity System, which takes a holistic approach to simplify and connect key aspects of insulin management. It is the first-of-its-kind smart pen cap that incorporates integrated continuous glucose monitor (iCGM) data and healthcare provider instructions to provide insulin dose recommendations for people with diabetes. The program aims to simplify and improve diabetes management by providing simple and easy-to-use solutions, reducing the burden on people with insulin-requiring diabetes, and supporting healthcare providers in optimizing diabetes care. The FreeStyle Libre 2 sensor provides the Bigfoot Unity System with hypoglycemia alerts in real time. The FreeStyle Libre brand is the #1 CGM worldwide.

The startup aims to provide funding solutions for companies that develop life-changing products for those living with the Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). It combines venture capital and philanthropy to create a new investment market for products such as therapeutics, devices, vaccines, and diagnostics. The T1D Fund was launched in December 2016 and focuses solely on T1D. The team behind the fund includes managing directors and associates who are involved in investment committees. The JDRF T1D Fund's goal is to deliver solutions and alleviate or even solve the problems faced by people living with T1D. Contact information is available to interested parties via email.

Veralox Therapeutics is a biotechnology company that is developing therapies targeting 12-lipoxygenase (12-LOX) pathway to address the underlying cause of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) and Type 1 diabetes (T1D). Their novel small molecule 12-LOX inhibitor, VLX-1005, has received Orphan Designation and Fast Track Designation for the treatment of HIT, a deadly syndrome characterized by hyperactivated platelets and pro-thrombotic state. By inhibiting 12-LOX and shutting down production of its products like 12-HETE, ? cells are able to function properly by producing more insulin and becoming more resilient to immune attack in T1D. Their goal is to develop first-in-class small molecule therapeutics to treat life-threatening immuno-inflammatory diseases with significant unmet medical needs.

DiogenX is a preclinical stage biotech company developing innovative biologics as new therapeutic options for diabetic patients worldwide. Their lead program targets beta-cell failure by stimulating functional beta-cell recovery to rebalance glucose/insulin homeostasis for improved glycemic control. The company's goal is to provide new therapeutic solutions for diabetic patients by restoring endogenous insulin production. They leverage the know-how and expertise from the laboratory of Dr Patrick Collombat and a large network of experts to develop their drug candidate intended to regenerate the functional pancreatic islets and slow down the progression towards beta-cell failure. Through their mission, they aim to take the Type 1 diabetes community off the complex tightrope between competing dangers in their daily lives.

Startup i2o Therapeutics aims to solve the problem of delivering biologics through oral consumption by developing disruptive ionic liquid technology. This technology will assist in delivering biologics to the body without the need for injections, thereby resulting in less patient discomfort and lower healthcare costs. Their goal is to make oral delivery of biologics more convenient and affordable for patients with chronic diseases such as diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, and cancer.

JDRF is a global organization that focuses on improving the lives of people with type 1 diabetes (T1D) through research, advocacy, and community engagement. The organization partners with academia, clinicians, insurers, and regulators to accelerate the development and approval of new therapies and devices for T1D. They provide resources such as guides, programs, and connections to help people with T1D manage their condition and navigate life with it. They also organize events, such as the JDRF One Walk, to raise awareness and funds for T1D research. JDRF advocates for government funding and healthcare policies that support the affordability, choice, and coverage of T1D therapies.

The startup aims to develop new classes of cell therapies to treat diseases across oncology, autoimmune and infectious diseases. They have developed a proprietary technology called Cell Squeeze that can effectively deliver various therapeutic cargo to cells while preserving cell function. The technology is being used to develop cell therapies that activate CD8 T cells against diseases. They have two clinical trials ongoing, one using the SQZ AAC Platform for HPV16+ solid tumors and the other using the SQZ eAPC Platform for the same. These therapies use a patient's own cells and various antigens to activate the immune system. The startup is using their expertise and insights to unlock the full potential of cell therapies for patients around the world.

an Randall has been involved in numerous charitable causes, including starting The Justice Ball, one of the country's largest fundraisers. He has also endowed a permanent scholarship at the University of Michigan for students pursuing a career in business. In addition to his philanthropic work, Randall is an accomplished entrepreneur with a background in marketing, operations, and CPG development. He is the co-founder of Akamai Technologies, which serves nearly 30% of the world's web traffic, and he is also the CEO of JUMP Investors, a family office that invests in real estate, private equity, hedge funds, and public equities. Randall is also the founder and CEO of Sandee, a travel company focused on promoting beaches and beach tourism, as well as the co-founder and Co-CEO of Thrive Properties, a real estate investment firm. Lastly, he is the owner and CEO of CollarCard, LLC, a promotional products company that makes men's collar stays.

Baobab Studios aims to create interactive stories that combine elements of animation and video games. Its mission is to inspire people to dream and bring out their sense of wonder. Baobab Studios is a leading interactive animation studio focusing on the production of next-generation narrative movie content. Their award-winning short films, such as Invasion! and Crow: The Legend, have premiered at film festivals such as Cannes and Tribeca. Baobab Studios also develops games and TV series that expand the universe of their short films, such as Momo Quest and Intercats.

Chime is a financial technology company that offers banking services and is not a traditional bank. They provide an online banking app that allows users to set up direct deposit, access a fee-free network of ATMs, and use the optional SpotMe service that lets them overdraw their account up to $200 without any fees. They also offer early access to direct deposit funds, with availability of funds depending on the timing of the payment file. Chime is dedicated to providing 24/7 support to their users, and they recommend reviewing the privacy statements and terms of any third-party websites before using their services. Chime is also focused on helping users build credit with regular on-time payment history.

Cycle is a test automation platform that helps implementation teams validate high-impact business processes and reduce deployment risk by detecting quality issues earlier and more frequently. Cycle offers an all-in-one solution for comprehensive testing that covers all system interfaces and applications, reducing the need for multiple tools. Traditional manual testing requires SMEs and can only start after the solution is delivered, increasing the risk of delays and quality issues. Cycle's automated testing helps organizations innovate more freely and rapidly by reducing deployment risk and manual testing load, and it can be applied across a wide variety of industries, serving Fortune 500 companies.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup aims to have a direct communication channel with their customers and potential clients by collecting their contact information to be able to send them periodic updates and promotional offers through their newsletter. By subscribing to the newsletter, users can stay informed about the latest news, products, and events related to the startup, and also have the opportunity to give feedback and make comments on the services offered. The goal of collecting this information is to create a loyal audience that is interested in their business, while also providing value to them through the newsletter.

Corevist is offering a platform for B2B eCommerce that seamlessly integrates with SAP ERP system which helps manufacturers as their comprehensive prebuilt integration reduces the risks associated with SAP integration. They deliver personalized solutions to customers cost-effectively. The solution is quick and easy to implement with great integration with SAP. Their solutions help businesses to leverage their ERP investment in their digital channel which significantly increases their digital revenue growth. Corevist consults with clients on their goals and helps them find the best solutions to their business problems.

WorkDove is a platform that offers a simple and easy way to track goals to help build a high-performing team. Through their digital coaching files and performance objectives tracking, they provide companies with a framework to become more aware of the behaviors needed to achieve strategic goals. Their platform offers a cost-effective and quick launch performance management system that integrates with third-party platforms and tools to adapt to individual needs. The software helps organizations in measuring performance objectives, tracking growth, and identifying areas for improvement to develop a healthy and high-performing team. The pricing for the platform starts at $5,000 per year.

Roobrik offers Insight Solutions™ that help providers in the senior living industry to reach the hidden audience by providing personalized education and recommendations through their motivational interviewing tool. Their Insight Report gives sales advisors insights to start a conversation with what matters most for the prospects and providers. Roobrik also provides demographics, corporate, community, and industry-level data to keep providers informed about the buyer journey, which is constantly changing. Roobrik Deliver Proven Results by increasing high-quality web leads and faster conversion rates than other web leads. They offer solutions for Active Adult and Life Plan Communities, Assisted Living, and Memory Care, which helps prospects make smart choices and build trust.

Juvo is a venture capital firm that is committed to ensuring the privacy of visitors to its website. They provide visitors with control over their personal information by allowing them to manage their cookie settings and opt-out of receiving targeted ads from members of the Network Advertising Initiative (NAI) on the NAI's website. They also collect limited information through their website, including name and email address, which they use to contact visitors about their programs and provide additional information as needed. They only authorize access to visitors' personal information to employees and business partners who need it to perform their duties, and they safeguard this information through electronic, procedural, and physical means. They do not release, sell, rent, or trade visitors' personal information gathered on the website.

Stride Funding aims to solve the problem of de-risking the cost of education for students who may not have access to traditional financing options. It provides affordable, flexible funding options such as income share loans, deferred tuition agreements, and custom financing solutions. The company does not require a cosigner or minimum FICO score for funding, and it offers transparent, outcomes-based alternatives to help students fund their education. Additionally, Stride Funding provides 1:1 ongoing and post-grad career support, making paying for education less stressful and more accessible to a broader range of students. Overall, Stride Funding helps to make funding education feel more personalized, transparent, and student-centric.

Stride Funding is solving the problem of student debt by providing flexible and affordable financing options for education that do not require a cosigner nor a minimum FICO score. The startup offers income share loans, deferred tuition agreements, and custom financing solutions that are based on outcomes rather than credit history. They also provide 1:1 career support and transparency with no hidden fees to help students de-risk the cost of education. Stride Funding's goal is to offer a student-centric funding solution that opens doors for students who may not have access to traditional financing options.

SV Academy aims to solve the problem of underrepresented job seekers who want to pivot into high-growth business careers, but lack the resources or desire to go to business school. They offer a 4-week intensive training program that prepares job seekers from different backgrounds for entry-level positions in Sales or Business Development. They match job seekers within 24 hours after a hiring team reaches out, they support managers and hires with 6 months of professional coaching, and they have a large community of early-career sales professionals ready to be matched with companies. Their mission is to generate $100B in wealth expansion for underrepresented job seekers, and they are disrupting the tech industry by creating opportunities for their graduates to drive change within their portfolio companies.

PAIRIN is a software company that offers an AI-powered platform called My Journey, which aims to provide equitable career and education journeys for all people regardless of their age or stage of life. The platform integrates data from various workforce agencies into one place, streamlining the referral process. It offers auto-personalized content and access to resources to support skill development and career services for Workforce Development, Government, and Educational institutions. The platform allows users to understand their skill sets and chart personalized journeys to arrive well-prepared for success in their career and education.

ReadyCNA is a comprehensive cloud-based training program that prepares individuals for careers as Certified Nursing Assistants (CNAs) by providing interactive curriculum and Hollywood-quality movie depiction of the life of a newly hired CNA. It helps to prepare them for emotional and interpersonal challenges of the job and provides instruction emphasizing on key knowledge and skills needed to succeed as a CNA. This program is aimed at addressing the challenge facing residential healthcare facilities in training and retaining qualified staff, and aims to improve pass rates, retention, and CNA skill levels. The program has been employed by healthcare providers, training providers, and home health agencies and has received appreciation for its flexibility and interactive module. The program aims to provide a stimulating training that meets real-life emotions for lasting effects on the behavior of the learners.

Onramp is a talent development platform that aims to bridge the gap between job seekers lacking traditional education and employers in need of diverse technical talent. The platform offers a skills-based hiring process, apprenticeships, and upskilling programs for candidates who want to transition into tech and data jobs. Onramp partners with companies to deliver a pipeline of trained and qualified candidates that meet their specific hiring needs. The platform's success is reflected in the testimonials of its clients and candidates who have landed their dream jobs or found great talents through Onramp. Onramp also values diversity, equity, and inclusion in its hiring practices, which ensures that its candidate pool is more diverse than the typical university's recruiting pools.

Startup aims to solve the problem of finding the right talent for teams. The company believes that the old listening-based learning system fails to deliver the new economy skills required for workforce-ready graduates. They offer a cloud-based online team-based learning platform, InteDashboard that helps educators digitize and streamline learning processes with immediate feedback, application case exercises, and 360-degree peer evaluations. The platform aids in team-based learning that prepares people for the 21st century workforce with better skills, outcomes, efficiency, scale, and equity. Their goal is to replace traditional lectures with team-based learning and transform education.

MentorWorks Education Capital offers ISAs to well-qualified students to provide affordable access to quality education, support, and mentorship to improve graduation and job placement outcomes. MentorWorks validates candidates' education and work experience before they enter the talent pool and facilitates the matching process between candidates and employers. The ISA payments are based on a percentage of the students' income, which means that payments don't start until they make above the minimum salary level in their ISA contract. MentorWorks has built an infrastructure and partnerships with a focus on regulatory compliance, social impact, diversity, and inclusion. Blue Ridge Bank, N.A. can issue ISAs.

Riipen solves the problem of bridging the gap between higher education and employment by providing a work-based learning platform that enables educators, organizations, and learners to collaborate on real industry projects. It offers experiential learning projects to colleges and universities that allow students to gain real-world experience, develop employable skills, and improve graduate employment outcomes. Through Riipen, colleges and universities can access thousands of organizations and experiential learning projects, saving time in finding relevant employers. The platform enhances course content and curriculum by applying an experiential learning approach to drastically improve educational outcomes. In addition, Riipen partners with workforce development providers to create equitable career-advancing opportunities.

Transit Labs helps cities standardize public transit data and empowers them to improve traffic flows, coordinate with infrastructure stakeholders, and plan for a sustainable future. The startup provides analytics and technology solutions to help with bus route planning, scheduling, and asset management, transit access household travel demand analysis, transit performance in intensive cities, roadway safety and bridge conditions, development of intelligent transportation systems and a data bank for global investors interested in infrastructure projects. Transit Labs aims to help cities access and analyze infrastructure data through tools they provide.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: NewConnect is a startup that is solving the problem of slow and unreliable internet for businesses. They offer high-speed internet with dedicated Gig speeds from 100 to 1000 Mbps up and down, always ensuring fast and reliable internet that matches the needs and budget of the businesses. The startup offers bandwidth options and pricing that are flexible for clients. NewConnect promises guaranteed performance backed by leading SLA, with complete outage avoidance and no shared single points of failure. They also provide a diverse feed from all providers, which assures the 100% performance of their services. Their goal is to provide the fastest and most reliable internet to their clients while delivering service in seven days or less.

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Startup Launcher aims to solve the problem of delivering small satellites into space at the lowest cost. To achieve this, they have developed the world's most efficient rockets and transfer vehicles, and use a unique strategy with a scalable rocket architecture. They provide both a rideshare service and a dedicated launch service with their satellites transfer vehicle and platform, named Orbiter. Orbiter can launch satellites via a large rideshare rocket and customize that orbit to the satellite's exact needs, making it flexible and cost-effective. Launcher's goal is to make space more accessible and affordable for everyone.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C, Late Stage

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: Allumia is helping utilities, particularly small and mid-sized businesses, to build and manage their energy efficiency programs, from planning to execution to management. They offer an Efficiency-as-a-Service through their Skylight platform that outsources all the heavy lifting to them. By using their software and IoT platform, utilities can meet and beat their clean energy goals while their customers save energy, money, and time. Allumia helps their customers and partners track their progress toward a cleaner, greener future with deep metering and analytics, and they also offer funding and program management driven by AI. Their mission is to make energy efficiency easy and sustainable for everyone.
venture_capital_fund_investment_stages: Seed, Series A, Series B, Series C, Late Stage

startup_solution_in_which_venture_capita: VitusVet is a veterinary practice management platform that helps veterinary professionals to modernize their daily operations, automating reminders, and offering contactless payments while keeping profit in their practice. By integrating their platform with all leading PIMS, VitusVet offers support to all their users, making it easy to communicate and market to clients in a way that they are comfortable receiving it. VitusVet also has a feature that provides pet owners with access to routine records, prescription refill requests, and personalized reminders - right from their mobile phones. Through their platform, VitusVet aims to simplify practice management and reduce stress in veterinary practices.
